title: Godrej Consumer Products share price falls 2.01% in morning trade
content: Shares of Godrej Consumer Products declined by 2.01% to trade at Rs 1,241.10 at 11:07 am. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Next 50 index. Financial Performance: The following table presents the consolidated quarterly financial data for Godrej Consumer Products:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 3,331.58 CroreRs 3,666.33 CroreRs 3,768.43 CroreRs 3,597.95 CroreRs 3,661.86 CroreNet ProfitRs 450.69 CroreRs 491.31 CroreRs 498.31 CroreRs 411.90 CroreRs 452.45 CroreEPS4.414.804.874.034.42The revenue for Godrej Consumer Products has shown a fluctuating trend over the last five quarters, with a recent increase from Rs 3,597.95 Crore in March 2025 to Rs 3,661.86 Crore in June 2025. Similarly, the net profit saw a rise from Rs 411.90 Crore to Rs 452.45 Crore during the same period. The EPS also increased marginally from 4.03 to 4.42. The net profit experienced a significant dip in 2024 to Rs -560.55 Crore but recovered to Rs 1,852.30 Crore in 2025. EPS follows a similar trend, with a recovery in 2025 to 18.11 after a negative value in 2024. The debt-to-equity ratio has also increased from 0.08 in 2021 to 0.32 in 2025. title: Nifty 50 Top Gainers Today: Eicher Motors, Maruti Suzuki, Shriram Finance stock lead gains on benchmark index
content: At 11:00 am on Friday, shares of Eicher Motors, Shriram Finance, and Maruti Suzuki were among the top gainers on the Nifty 50. Eicher Motors was trading at Rs 6,882.00, a gain of 1.83%. Shriram Finance was trading at Rs 630.05, up 1.61%, while Maruti Suzuki was trading at Rs 15,336.00, up 1.6%. Axis Bank and Infosys were also among the top gainers, with gains of 1.55% and 1.28%, respectively. Eicher Motors Eicher Motors' revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 5,041.84 Crore, compared to Rs 4,393.05 Crore in June 2024. The company's net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 1,048.11 Crore, compared to Rs 926.90 Crore in June 2024. The EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 43.95, compared to Rs 40.21 in June 2024. The consolidated yearly revenue saw consistent growth, reaching Rs 18,870.35 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, up from Rs 16,535.78 Crore in March 2024. Net profit also increased, with Rs 4,034.63 Crore recorded for the year-ending March 2025, up from Rs 3,553.29 Crore in March 2024. Additionally, the EPS rose to Rs 172.76 for the year-ending March 2025, up from Rs 146.18 in March 2024. Table: Eicher Motors Financials (Crore)HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 4,393.05 CroreRs 4,263.07 CroreRs 4,973.12 CroreRs 5,241.11 CroreRs 5,041.84 CroreNet ProfitRs 926.90 CroreRs 986.58 CroreRs 1,006.99 CroreRs 1,114.16 CroreRs 1,048.11 CroreEPS40.2140.1542.7049.6943.95 Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 8,720.35 CroreRs 10,297.83 CroreRs 14,442.18 CroreRs 16,535.78 CroreRs 18,870.35 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,315.76 CroreRs 1,616.45 CroreRs 2,598.77 CroreRs 3,553.29 CroreRs 4,034.63 CroreEPS49.3061.33106.56146.18172.76BVPS418.52461.16548.09659.08776.68ROE11.7713.2919.4322.1722.23Debt to Equity0.010.000.010.020.01 Eicher Motors announced a final dividend of Rs 70 per share on May 14, 2025, with an effective date of August 1, 2025. Maruti Suzuki Maruti Suzuki's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 38,605.20 Crore, compared to Rs 35,779.40 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. The company's net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 3,756.90 Crore, compared to Rs 3,702.10 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. The EPS stood at Rs 120.62 for the quarter-ending June 2025, compared to Rs 119.58 for the quarter-ending June 2024. The company's consolidated yearly revenue increased from Rs 141,858.20 Crore for the year-ending March 2024 to Rs 152,913.00 Crore for the year-ending March 2025. The net profit also increased from Rs 13,234.10 Crore to Rs 14,256.30 Crore, and the EPS increased from Rs 429.01 to Rs 461.20 during the same period. title: Jubilant Foodworks shares fall 2.01%; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Jubilant Foodworks declined by 2.01%, trading at Rs 638.55 on Friday. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Performance: Jubilant Foodworks' consolidated financial performance shows the following trends: Quarterly Results:Revenue: Increased from Rs 1,933.06 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 2,260.86 Crore in June 2025.Net Profit: Rose from Rs 60.65 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 91.14 Crore in June 2025.EPS: Increased from Rs 0.89 in June 2024 to Rs 1.43 in June 2025.The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,260.86 Crore, marking an increase compared to previous quarters. The net profit for the same period was Rs 91.14 Crore. Earnings per share (EPS) also saw an increase, reaching Rs 1.43. Annual Results:Revenue: Increased from Rs 3,311.87 Crore in 2021 to Rs 8,141.73 Crore in 2025.Net Profit: Fluctuated over the years, with a profit of Rs 236.63 Crore in 2025.EPS: Reported at Rs 3.19 in 2025.BVPS: Stood at Rs 31.87 in 2025.ROE: Was 10.02% in 2025.Debt to Equity: Ratio of 0.71 in 2025.The company's annual revenue has shown consistent growth, reaching Rs 8,141.73 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 5,654.09 Crore in March 2024. However, the net profit decreased to Rs 236.63 Crore in March 2025, from Rs 384.84 Crore in March 2024. title: GRSE, Mazagon Dock, other defence stocks rally up to 6% on fresh order wins, heavy volumes
content: The shares of defence companies surged on September 12, pushing the Nifty India Defence index up nearly 3 percent in the morning. This comes amid fresh order wins and heavy trading volumes. The Nifty India Defence index rose to 7,922, as seen as 10.42 am. Garden Reach Shipbuilders & Engineers (GRSE) shares were the top gainers on the index, jumping nearly 6 percent to trade at Rs 2,490.20 apiece. Nearly 13 lakh shares of the company have been involved in active trade today so far, according to NSE. This is nearly double that of the stock’s 10-day average volumes. Notably, today is also the record date for determining the eligibility of the shareholders set to receive a dividend of Rs 4.9 per share. MTAR Technologies shares followed, also rising nearly 6 percent to trade at Rs 1,619 apiece. Earlier this week, the company announced that it has won orders worth $43.87 million (approximately Rs 386 crore) from Bloom Energy Corporation. The stock currently sees volumes three times higher than its 10-day average. Astra Microwave Products shares jumped around 5 percent, while Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders shares surged more than 4 percent. Notably, September 19 is the record date for Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders’ Rs 2.71 per share dividend payment. Paras Defence and BEML shares gained nearly 4 percent each, as both the stocks see heavy trading volumes. Paras Defence on September 12 announced that it has won incremental orders worth Rs 26.6 crore from Opto Electronics Factory (OLF) for supply of Electronic Control Systems used in Thermal Imaging Fire Control System (TIFCS) for Battle Tank application delivered by OLF to Indian Armed Forces. Bharat Dynamics (BDL) and Hindustan Aeronautics (HAL) shares gained around 3 percent. The record date for Bharat Dynamics' Rs 0.65 per share dividend has been set on September 19. Solar Industries, Cochin Shipyard and Bharat Electronics (BEL) shares jumped more than 2 percent each. The record date to determine the eligibility of shareholders set to receive Rs 2.25 per share dividend from Cochin Shipyard is today (September 12). Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

summary_luhn: The record date to determine the eligibility of shareholders set to receive Rs 2.25 per share dividend from Cochin Shipyard is today (September 12).

title: Infosys shares among top gainers on Nifty 50; stock rises 1.27%
content: Shares of Infosys were trading positively, with the stock among the top gainers on Nifty 50, rising 1.27% to Rs 1,528.90 at 11:10 am. This increase reflects a positive movement from its previous close. The P/E ratio has decreased from 29.99 in March 2021 to 24.35 in March 2025. Corporate Actions: Infosys' board has proposed a buyback of equity shares, according to a BSE announcement on September 11, 2025. Additionally, Infosys and Hanesbrands Inc. have collaborated to unlock hyper productivity and AI-driven efficiency. Bank CTBC Indonesia has adopted Infosys Finacle digital banking solution on the cloud. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 22 per share (440%) effective May 30, 2025. Prior dividends include an interim dividend of Rs 21 per share (420%) on October 29, 2024, and a final dividend of Rs 20 per share (400%) along with a special dividend of Rs 8 per share (160%) on May 31, 2024. Infosys has a history of bonus issues, including a 1:1 bonus on September 4, 2018, and several others in previous years. The company had a stock split on January 24, 2000, with the face value changing from Rs 10 to Rs 5. Moneycontrol analysis, as of September 9, 2025, indicates a neutral sentiment for Infosys. With the stock currently trading at Rs 1,528.90, Infosys is experiencing positive momentum as one of the top gainers on the Nifty 50.

title: Hindustan Unilever share price falls 1.16%, hits day's low of Rs 2,585.20
content: Shares of Hindustan Unilever were trading lower in Friday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 2,591.60. The stock declined by 1.16% from its previous close, as of 10:40 am. The stock touched a day's high of Rs 2,628.90, and a low of Rs 2,585.20. HUL stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. title: GlaxoSmithKline Pharmaceuticals share price falls 2.04%; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of GlaxoSmithKline Pharmaceuticals declined 2.04% to Rs 2,805.30 in Friday's session, making it among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150. At 10:46 am, the stock experienced this downturn. Financial Overview The following tables provide an overview of GlaxoSmithKline Pharmaceuticals' financial performance, including quarterly and annual consolidated results. Consolidated Quarterly ResultsHeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 814.65 CroreRs 1,010.77 CroreRs 949.42 CroreRs 974.37 CroreRs 805.17 CroreNet ProfitRs 182.33 CroreRs 252.50 CroreRs 229.88 CroreRs 262.87 CroreRs 205.01 CroreEPS10.7614.9113.5715.5212.10The revenue for the quarter-ending September 2024 was Rs 1,010.77 Crore, which then decreased to Rs 974.37 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit saw a similar trend, peaking at Rs 262.87 Crore in March 2025. The revenue decreased by 1.16% from Rs 814.65 crore in June 2024 to Rs 805.17 crore in June 2025. The net profit increased by 12.4% from Rs 182.33 crore in June 2024 to Rs 205.01 crore in June 2025. Consolidated Yearly ResultsHeading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 2,925.60 CroreRs 3,278.03 CroreRs 3,251.72 CroreRs 3,453.71 CroreRs 3,749.21 CroreNet ProfitRs 287.27 CroreRs 380.77 CroreRs 607.64 CroreRs 589.96 CroreRs 927.58 CroreEPS31.3599.2936.0841.1454.52BVPS87.26157.19102.79104.93115.19ROE24.2263.6435.4133.4247.67Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The annual revenue has shown steady growth, increasing from Rs 2,925.60 Crore in 2021 to Rs 3,749.21 Crore in 2025. Net profit has also increased significantly from Rs 287.27 Crore in 2021 to Rs 927.58 Crore in 2025. The company’s debt to equity ratio has remained at zero for the past five years. title: Bharti Airtel shares rise 0.12%; touches day's high of Rs 1,925
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading up 0.12 percent in Friday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 1,915.30 at 10:40 am. title: Tata Consultancy Services shares rise marginally; hits day's high of Rs 3,148.70
content: Shares of Tata Consultancy Services were trading positively in Friday's session. At 10:40 am, the stock was trading at Rs 3,133.80 on the NSE, a 0.31% increase from the previous close. The stock touched a day's high of Rs 3,148.70, and a day's low of Rs 3,121.00. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. Tata Consultancy Services' consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,437 Crore, compared to Rs 62,613 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 12,819 Crore, up from Rs 12,105 Crore in the same quarter last year. The EPS for June 2025 was Rs 35.27, compared to Rs 33.28 in June 2024. The company's consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 255,324 Crore, marking an increase from Rs 240,893 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 48,797 Crore, compared to Rs 46,099 Crore in March 2024. The EPS stood at Rs 134.19 for March 2025, up from Rs 125.88 in March 2024. Key financial metrics include a book value per share of Rs 261.76 and a return on equity of 51.24% as of March 2025. The company's debt-to-equity ratio remains at 0.00 for the year-ending March 2025. Tata Consultancy Services has announced several press releases recently. On September 11, 2025, the company unveiled chiplet-based system engineering services to accelerate semiconductor innovation. Additionally, a TCS study revealed that AI and digital twins are set to redefine aerospace by 2035. Furthermore, TCS and CEA have partnered to advance physical AI research and innovation in France. The company has announced several dividends. An interim dividend of Rs 11 per share was announced on June 27, 2025, with an effective date of July 16, 2025. A final dividend of Rs 30 per share was announced on April 11, 2025, effective June 4, 2025. A special dividend of Rs 66 per share was announced on January 9, 2025, effective January 17, 2025. Tata Consultancy Services had previously issued bonus shares. A 1:1 bonus ratio was announced on April 19, 2018, with a record date of June 2, 2018, and an ex-bonus date of May 31, 2018. Similar 1:1 bonus ratios were announced on April 20, 2009, and April 17, 2006. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 3,133.80, Tata Consultancy Services has seen a marginal increase from its previous close.

title: Buy VRL Logistics; target of Rs 350: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on VRL Logistics VRL Logistics’ (VRLL) management implemented a price hike of 8-10% in Jun’24, which was rolled out across customer segments. The impact of the hike was still visible in 1QFY26, with volume dipping 13% YoY to 0.93m tons, while realization improved 17% YoY to INR7,852/tons. Though volumes declined due to this restructuring, EBITDA grew 74% YoY to INR1.5b, with margins at 20.4%, aided by better realizations, lower fuel costs, reduced lorry hire charges, and improved procurement efficiency (refinery sourcing at 41.5% vs. 33% YoY). Realizations are expected to remain stable, and no more pricing action is planned unless cost dynamics shift. FY26 volume growth is likely to remain flattish YoY, but FY27 is poised for 7-8% growth. Outlook We expect VRLL to clock flat volumes and a revenue/EBITDA/PAT CAGR of 6%/10%/19% over FY25- 27. Reiterate BUY with a TP of INR350 (based on 24x FY27 EPS). For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. VRL Logistics - 12092025 - moti

title: Auto stocks snap three-day losses as Citi cites trifecta of macro tailwinds; Maruti, Hyundai rise up to 1.5%
content: Auto shares rebounded on Friday after three straight sessions of losses, with Maruti Suzuki India and Hyundai Motor India leading the gains, as brokerage firm Citi highlighted multiple macro triggers supportive of the sector. The Nifty Auto index rose nearly 1 percent in early trade, emerging among the top sectoral gainers. The rebound came after profit-booking in the previous three sessions, which followed four consecutive days of gains spurred by the GST Council’s decision to cut taxes on several categories of vehicles. Citi, in its note, said a combination of income tax restructuring, interest rate cuts and the recent GST rate revisions are expected to provide a favourable environment for the automobile industry, reported CNBC-TV18. The brokerage raised its price targets on key auto companies — Maruti Suzuki India Ltd, Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd and Hyundai Motor India Ltd. It reiterated a "buy" rating on all three counters, projecting Maruti at Rs 17,500, M&M at Rs 4,170 and Hyundai at Rs 2,900. Maruti Suzuki remains Citi’s top pick in the sector. At around 10:45 am, shares of Maruti Suzuki were up 1.53 percent at Rs 15,326, Hyundai Motor India rose 1.33 percent to Rs 2,541.10, while Mahindra & Mahindra advanced 0.5 percent to Rs 3,612. The three stocks have gained between 10 percent and 20 percent over the past month. Citi noted that the combination of lower interest rates, tax changes and GST cuts could drive industry growth beyond its earlier projections. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

The other top gainers on the Nifty 50 were Maruti Suzuki, Tata Motors, Tata Steel and Axis Bank. title: Luggage makers VIP and Safari are a bet on travel surge and premiumisation as MOSL initiates with Buy calls
content: Domestic luggage makers VIP and Safari are now on Motilal Oswal's coverage list after the brokerage initiated with Buy recommendations on September 12, backing the post-pandemic demand surge to continue, with premiumisation and e-commerce driving the expansion. The note said India's luggage industry is poised to reach Rs 26,700 crore turnover by CY28 at a CAGR of 12% between CY23-28, with established players driving the growth. "Branded players, holding a 52% market share in CY23, are expected to outpace overall industry growth, propelled by rising disposable incomes, rapid urbanization, and resurgence in both domestic and international travel," said MOSL. The shift from unbranded to branded will be driven by innovation, premiumization and e-commerce, said Motilal, spurring both volume and value growth in the organized segment. MOSL cited industry observers who believe that luggage is now increasingly being seen as A 'status symbol', helped by social trends. The leading brands in India - VIP, Samsonite and Safari - together command around 33% of the market share. Motilal Oswal said it is initiating coverage on VIP and Safari Industries with Buy ratings and targets of Rs 530 per share and Rs 2,700 per share respectively. Over the last six months, shares of VIP Industries are higher by 54 percent, while those of Safari Industries are higher by 13 percent. The mass market of sub-Rs 4,000 luggage makes up the bulk of first-time buyers of brands at around 60 percent of the market, said MOSL, which translates into Rs 10,200 crore of turnover. This category is driven by brands like Safari, Aristocrat and Kamiliant with aggressive pricing and strong distribution network. The mid-market segment is dominated by VIP (21% share via VIP and Skybags) and American Tourister (around 17% shares), which have 'strong brand recall and omnichannel presence'. These players are targeting 'upwardly mobile, value-conscious consumers', with smart designs, seasonal launches, and curated retail formats, said MOSL. The premium segment, which is about 10% of the market, is dominated by legacy brands like Samsonite and Carlton - commanding 20 percent and 8 percent market share - that are maintaining leadership in the business and international travel segments. "...premium luggage is evolving into a lifestyle accessory — blending status, style, and self-expression — fuelled by rising incomes, social aspirations, and the growing influence of digital culture," said Motilal Oswal. The segment is seeing new D2C entrants like Mokobara and Uppercase leveraging a digital-first strategy and influencer marketing to resonate with millennial and Gen Z consumers. title: Silver futures cross Rs 1.3-lakh mark; MCX, Hindustan Zinc shares rise up to 2%
content: Silver prices jumped on September 12, outperforming gold. Future contracts of the precious-industrial metal hit fresh record highs, pushing the shares of MCX and Hindustan Zinc higher into the green. Silver futures with December expiry hit a fresh all time high of Rs 1,28,612 per kilogram on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) today. Silver contracts with March expiry rose nearly Rs 1,600 (over 1 percent) to hit Rs 1.3 lakh per kilogram for the first time ever. In the domestic market, the price of silver jumped Rs 2,100 per kilogram in a single day to Rs 1.32 lakh per kg, according to data on Investorgain. Gold futures on MCX with October expiry meanwhile rose around Rs 575 per 10 grams to trade at Rs 1,09,656. They are currently close to their all-time high level of Rs 1,09,840 per 10 grams. MCX shares jumped more than 2 percent to trade at Rs 7,730 apiece. The stock has so far fallen more than 5 percent in the past one month, but gained nearly 62 percent in the past six months. The stock is up nearly 23 percent in 2025 so far. The shares of Hindustan Zinc rose more than 1 percent to trade at Rs 453 apiece on the back of a notable surge in silver prices in India. Hindustan Zinc is the largest producer of silver in India, and produces refined silver with a minimum 99.9 percent purity. The sharp rise in the bullion's prices is expected to further boost the stock. Hindustan Zinc shares have jumped nearly 3 percent in the past five days, and nearly 7 percent in the past one month. The Vedanta Group stock has fallen around 8 percent in the past one year. Its P/E ratio currently stands at over 18. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: GAIL India shares rise 2.12% in morning trade
content: Shares of GAIL India were trading higher at Rs 182.81, up 2.12% in Friday's session. The stock is a constituent of the NIFTY NEXT 50 index. title: Cochin Shipyard shares rise 2.30% in morning trade
content: Shares of Cochin Shipyard were trading at Rs 1,689.20, up 2.30% in morning trade. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Snapshot: Cochin Shipyard's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth. The company's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 4,819.96 Crore, compared to Rs 3,830.45 Crore in the previous year. Net profit for the same period was Rs 827.33 Crore, up from Rs 783.28 Crore. The earnings per share (EPS) increased to Rs 31.45 from Rs 29.77. The company’s quarterly performance also reflects this growth trajectory. For the quarter-ending June 2025, Cochin Shipyard reported a revenue of Rs 1,068.59 Crore and a net profit of Rs 187.83 Crore. title: Hindustan Aeronautics shares rise 2.08% in today's trading session
content: Shares of Hindustan Aeronautics were trading higher at Rs 4,676.60, up 2.08% from the previous close, at 10:18 am on Friday. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Next 50 index. Financial Snapshot: The following table presents a summary of the company's financial performance:ParticularsMar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025Revenue (Rs Crore)22,754.5424,620.0226,927.4630,381.0830,980.95Net Profit (Rs Crore)3,234.255,080.115,824.867,594.458,323.40EPS96.87151.92174.28113.95125.07The company's revenue increased by 1.97% from Rs 30,381.08 crore in March 2024 to Rs 30,980.95 crore in March 2025. The net profit also increased by 9.6% from Rs 7,594.45 crore to Rs 8,323.40 crore during the same period.ParticularsJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025Revenue (Rs Crore)4,347.505,976.296,957.3113,699.854,819.01Net Profit (Rs Crore)1,431.111,498.461,434.363,959.471,373.49EPS21.4922.5921.5359.4620.69Compared to the quarter ending June 2024, the revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 increased by 10.85% from Rs 4,347.50 crore to Rs 4,819.01 crore. However, the net profit decreased by 4.03% from Rs 1,431.11 crore to Rs 1,373.49 crore during the same period. title: Bharti Airtel share price flat in today's trading session
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading at Rs 1,914.30, a marginal gain of 0.07% from the previous close, at 10:00 am. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. In terms of quarterly performance, Bharti Airtel's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 49,462.60 Crore, a notable increase compared to Rs 38,506.40 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 7,339.00 Crore, also higher than the Rs 3,805.80 Crore reported in June 2024. The company's earnings per share (EPS) increased to Rs 10.26 in June 2025 from Rs 7.21 in June 2024. title: TCS shares rise marginally in morning trade today
content: Shares of Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) were trading at Rs 3,130.60, up 0.20% in Friday's session. This comes as the stock showed a marginal increase from its previous close, with trading activity observed on the NSE at 10:00 am. Tata Consultancy Services is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. Tata Consultancy Services' consolidated financial performance reveals consistent revenue and net profit growth. The quarterly revenue has increased from Rs 62,613.00 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 63,437.00 Crore in June 2025. Similarly, the net profit rose from Rs 12,105.00 Crore to Rs 12,819.00 Crore over the same period. The company’s Earnings Per Share (EPS) also saw an increase, moving from Rs 33.28 in June 2024 to Rs 35.27 in June 2025. Here is a summary of the company's consolidated quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 62,613.00 CroreRs 64,259.00 CroreRs 63,973.00 CroreRs 64,479.00 CroreRs 63,437.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 12,105.00 CroreRs 11,955.00 CroreRs 12,444.00 CroreRs 12,293.00 CroreRs 12,819.00 CroreEPS33.2832.9234.2133.7935.27The annual financial performance shows robust growth trends. Revenue increased steadily from Rs 164,177.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 255,324.00 Crore in 2025. Net profit also rose consistently from Rs 32,562.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 48,797.00 Crore in 2025. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) improved from Rs 86.71 in 2021 to Rs 134.19 in 2025. Key financial ratios reflect strong performance. Return on Equity (ROE) increased from 37.52% in 2021 to 51.24% in 2025. The company maintained a Debt to Equity ratio of 0.00 throughout the period. Here is a summary of the company's consolidated yearly financial performance:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 164,177.00 CroreRs 191,754.00 CroreRs 225,458.00 CroreRs 240,893.00 CroreRs 255,324.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 32,562.00 CroreRs 38,449.00 CroreRs 42,303.00 CroreRs 46,099.00 CroreRs 48,797.00 CroreEPS86.71103.62115.19125.88134.19BVPS235.43245.48249.20252.26261.76ROE37.5242.9946.6150.7351.24Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The company’s Income Statement provides further insights. Annual sales increased from Rs 164,177 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 255,324 Crore in March 2025. Similarly, net profit increased from Rs 32,562 Crore to Rs 48,797 Crore over the same period. Tata Consultancy Services has announced several press releases recently. On September 11, 2025, TCS unveiled Chiplet-Based System Engineering Services to accelerate semiconductor innovation. Additionally, a TCS study revealed that AI and Digital Twins are set to redefine aerospace by 2035. On September 9, 2025, TCS and CEA partnered to advance Physical AI Research and Innovation in France. The company has announced several dividends. An interim dividend of Rs 11.00 per share (1100%) was announced on June 27, 2025, with an effective date of July 16, 2025. A final dividend of Rs 30.00 per share (3000%) was announced on April 11, 2025, with an effective date of June 4, 2025. Tata Consultancy Services had previously issued bonus shares. A bonus ratio of 1:1 was announced on April 19, 2018, with an ex-bonus date of May 31, 2018. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 3,130.60, Tata Consultancy Services has seen a marginal rise from its previous close in today's session.

title: Top Nifty gainers: Axis Bank, L&T, Tata Motors stocks lead on Nifty 50 index in morning trade
content: At 10:00 am on Friday, several stocks were leading the gains on the Nifty 50 index. Axis Bank was trading at Rs 1,103.50, up 1.48%. Other top gainers included Larsen & Toubro (L&T), Tata Motors, Bajaj Finance, and Maruti Suzuki, showcasing positive momentum in these stocks during the trading session. Axis Bank is a major player in the financial services sector. Larsen operates in engineering and construction, Tata Motors in automobiles, Bajaj Finance in financial services, and Maruti Suzuki in the automobile industry. Axis Bank Financial Snapshot Axis Bank's financial performance reveals consistent growth in key areas. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 reached Rs 127,374 Crore, a notable increase compared to Rs 112,759 Crore in the previous year. The income statement provides further insights into Axis Bank's financial health. Interest earned increased from Rs 64,696 Crore in 2021 to Rs 127,374 Crore in 2025. Key balance sheet figures reveal the bank's financial structure. Share capital remained relatively stable, with a slight increase from Rs 612 Crore in 2021 to Rs 619 Crore in 2025. Deposits grew consistently, reaching Rs 1,170,920 Crore in 2025 from Rs 707,623 Crore in 2021. Borrowings also increased, standing at Rs 220,686 Crore in 2025. Total assets reached Rs 1,656,962 Crore in 2025. Capital adequacy ratios stood at 17% in March 2025. Axis Bank has been actively involved in corporate actions. Recent announcements include analyst/investor meetings and ESOP allotments. The bank announced a final dividend of Rs 1.00 per share (50%) on April 24, 2025. Larsen & Toubro Financials Larsen & Toubro (L&T) financial performance indicates strong growth. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 reached Rs 255,734.45 Crore, a substantial increase from Rs 221,112.91 Crore in the previous year. The net profit also saw a rise, climbing to Rs 17,687.39 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 15,569.72 Crore in March 2024. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) improved to Rs 109.36 in 2025 from Rs 93.96 in 2024. The Book Value Per Share (BVPS) decreased slightly to Rs 710.12 in 2025 from Rs 746.01 in 2024. Return on Equity (ROE) experienced a slight increase, from 15.12% in 2024 to 15.39% in 2025. Debt to Equity ratio remained almost same at 1.33 in 2025.Heading20212022202320242025SalesRs 135,979 CroreRs 156,521 CroreRs 183,340 CroreRs 221,112 CroreRs 255,734 CroreNet ProfitRs 4,668 CroreRs 10,291 CroreRs 12,624 CroreRs 15,569 CroreRs 17,687 CroreEPS82.4961.7174.5193.96109.36BVPS625.97678.79736.87746.01710.12ROE15.2610.5211.7215.1215.39Debt to Equity1.731.501.331.321.33Income Statement provides additional data of Larsen’s financials. Larsen’s sales increased from Rs 135,979 Crore in 2021 to Rs 255,734 Crore in 2025. Total income also increased from Rs 139,408 Crore in 2021 to Rs 259,859 Crore in 2025. The company’s total expenditure also increased from Rs 126,815 Crore to Rs 232,946 Crore. Net profit increased significantly from Rs 4,668 Crore in 2021 to Rs 17,687 Crore in 2025. Key figures from the balance sheet show Larsen’s financial structure. Share capital has decreased from Rs 1,404 Crore in 2021 to Rs 275 Crore in 2025. The company’s current liabilities have increased from Rs 137,408 Crore to Rs 201,970 Crore. Total assets have increased to Rs 379,524 Crore in 2025. Larsen has been actively involved in corporate actions. Recent announcements include newspaper publications, press releases, and partnerships for green ammonia projects. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 34.00 per share (1700%) on May 8, 2025. Tata Motors Financials Tata Motors' financial performance demonstrates growth. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 reached Rs 439,695.00 Crore, a slight increase compared to Rs 437,927.77 Crore in the previous year. However, the net profit decreased to Rs 22,991.00 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 31,106.95 Crore in March 2024. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) decreased to Rs 78.80 in 2025 from Rs 81.95 in 2024. The Book Value Per Share (BVPS) increased to Rs 315.61 in 2025 from Rs 242.90 in 2024. The Return on Equity (ROE) experienced a decrease, from 36.97% in 2024 to 23.96% in 2025. Debt to Equity ratio decreased from 1.16 to 0.54 in 2025.Heading20212022202320242025SalesRs 249,794 CroreRs 278,453 CroreRs 345,966 CroreRs 437,927 CroreRs 439,695 CroreNet ProfitRs -13,016 CroreRs -11,234 CroreRs 2,353 CroreRs 31,106 CroreRs 22,991 CroreEPS-36.99-29.886.2981.9578.80BVPS148.39127.50137.33242.90315.61ROE-24.34-25.675.3236.9723.96Debt to Equity2.083.132.771.160.54The income statement shows Tata Motors’ total sales increased from Rs 249,794 Crore in 2021 to Rs 439,695 Crore in 2025. The company’s net profit has also seen an increase, with a net profit of Rs 22,991 Crore in 2025. The balance sheet shows share capital increased from Rs 765 Crore in 2021 to Rs 3,200 Crore in 2025. Other liabilities have increased from Rs 130,129 Crore to Rs 93,351 Crore. The company’s contingent liabilities for March 2025 stood at Rs 50,740 Crore. Tata Motors has been actively involved in corporate actions including analyst/investor meetings. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 6.00 per share (300%) on May 13, 2025. Bajaj Finance Financials Bajaj Finance's financial performance indicates substantial growth. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 reached Rs 69,683.51 Crore, a significant increase compared to Rs 54,969.49 Crore in the previous year. The net profit also increased to Rs 16,761.67 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 14,443.53 Crore in March 2024. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) improved to Rs 268.94 in 2025 from Rs 236.89 in 2024. Additionally, a split from the face value of Rs 2 to Rs 1 and a bonus issue with a ratio of 4:1, both having ex-date as June 16, 2025. The net profit also saw an increase, climbing to Rs 14,256.30 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 13,234.10 Crore in March 2024. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) improved to Rs 461.20 in 2025 from Rs 429.01 in 2024. The Book Value Per Share (BVPS) also rose from Rs 2,723.79 in 2024 to Rs 3,061.07 in 2025. The balance sheet shows share capital increased from Rs 151 Crore in 2021 to Rs 157 Crore in 2025. The balance sheet shows the company’s total assets stood at Rs 131,971 Crore in March 2025. The company’s contingent liabilities for March 2025 stood at Rs 33,587 Crore. Maruti Suzuki’s recent corporate actions include press releases related to new vehicle launches and technology strategy briefings. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 135.00 per share (2700%) on April 25, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a neutral sentiment for these stocks as of September 10, 2025. title: HUL shares fall 1.1%, among top losers on Nifty 50 in morning trade
content: Shares of HUL were trading lower in Friday's session. At 10:00 am, the stock was priced at Rs 2,593.20 on the NSE, a 1.1% decline from the previous close. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty 50. Other stocks that are among the top losers on the Nifty 50 are SBI Life Insurance, HDFC Bank, Titan Company and Tata Consumer Products.Financial PerformanceHere's a look at the consolidated financial performance of HUL:Quarterly ResultsIn the quarter ended June 2025, HUL reported a revenue of Rs 16,514 Crore, compared to Rs 15,707 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 2,769 Crore, up from Rs 2,614 Crore year-over-year. The company’s earnings per share (EPS) stood at Rs 11.73 in June 2025, compared to Rs 11.11 in June 2024.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 15,707.00 CroreRs 15,926.00 CroreRs 15,818.00 CroreRs 15,670.00 CroreRs 16,514.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,614.00 CroreRs 2,601.00 CroreRs 2,988.00 CroreRs 2,476.00 CroreRs 2,769.00 CroreEPS11.1111.0312.7010.4811.73The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 increased by 5.14% compared to the quarter ending June 2024. Net profit for the same period saw an increase of 5.93%. The EPS increased from 11.11 to 11.73.Yearly ResultsHUL's consolidated yearly revenue has shown consistent growth over the past five years. In 2025, the company reported revenue of Rs 63,121 Crore, compared to Rs 47,028 Crore in 2021. The net profit has also increased steadily, reaching Rs 10,679 Crore in 2025 from Rs 8,000 Crore in 2021. The earnings per share (EPS) have risen from Rs 34.03 in 2021 to Rs 45.32 in 2025.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 47,028.00 CroreRs 52,446.00 CroreRs 60,580.00 CroreRs 61,896.00 CroreRs 63,121.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 8,000.00 CroreRs 8,887.00 CroreRs 10,145.00 CroreRs 10,286.00 CroreRs 10,679.00 CroreEPS34.0337.7943.0743.7445.32BVPS202.95208.88214.99217.95210.22ROE16.7718.0920.1120.0621.55Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00From 2021 to 2025, HUL has demonstrated a consistent increase in revenue, with a growth of 34.22%. The net profit has grown by 33.49% over the same period. Earnings per share have also risen steadily, reflecting the company's improved profitability.Annual Income StatementThe annual income statement for HUL shows steady growth in sales and total income over the past five years. Sales increased from Rs 47,028 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 63,121 Crore in March 2025. Total income also rose from Rs 47,438 Crore to Rs 64,138 Crore during the same period. Total expenditure increased from Rs 36,715 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 49,320 Crore in March 2025. title: Apollo Micro Systems shares extend rise as unit secures deal in US
content: Shares of Apollo Micro Systems Ltd extended gains for the third straight session on Friday, rising 9 percent over the period, after its step-down subsidiary secured a defence technology agreement in the United States. The company said Apollo Strategic Technologies Pvt Ltd (ASTPL), a subsidiary of Apollo Defence Industries Pvt Ltd (ADIPL), has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Dynamic Engineering and Design Inc, USA. The pact covers technology transfer, co-development and potential licensed production of rocket motors for BM-21 Grad ER and non-ER rockets. The agreement was signed at the DSEI exhibition in London on September 10, 2025. Apollo Micro Systems said the MoU marks a step towards indigenising propulsion technologies for multi-barrel rocket systems and advancing self-reliance in defence manufacturing under the government’s Make in India initiative. The group has already developed a 122mm rocket warhead in-house and plans to begin trials shortly, with full-scale production targeted by mid-2026. The collaboration will enable integration of indigenous warheads with domestically produced rocket motors, the company added. The BM-21 Grad rockets are among the most widely used unguided rockets globally. With this initiative, Apollo Micro Systems said it will become one of the few private Indian firms to offer a fully in-house developed rocket system, strengthening India’s position in the global defence supply chain. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Apollo Micro Systems said the MoU marks a step towards indigenising propulsion technologies for multi-barrel rocket systems and advancing self-reliance in defence manufacturing under the government’s Make in India initiative.
summary_luhn: The company said Apollo Strategic Technologies Pvt Ltd (ASTPL), a subsidiary of Apollo Defence Industries Pvt Ltd (ADIPL), has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Dynamic Engineering and Design Inc, USA.
summary_lsa: The group has already developed a 122mm rocket warhead in-house and plans to begin trials shortly, with full-scale production targeted by mid-2026.
summary_textrank: Shares of Apollo Micro Systems Ltd extended gains for the third straight session on Friday, rising 9 percent over the period, after its step-down subsidiary secured a defence technology agreement in the United States.

The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Next 50 index. title: Oracle Financial Services Software shares fall 2% in early trade
content: Shares of Oracle Financial Services Software declined by 2% to Rs 8,954.50 in early trade. At 09:52 am, the stock was trading lower on the NSE. Oracle Financial Services Software is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On September 11, 2025, the Exchange sought clarification from Oracle Financial Services Software Ltd regarding movement in volume; the reply is awaited. Financial Snapshot: Oracle Financial Services Software's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 1,852.20 Crore, compared to Rs 1,741.40 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 641.90 Crore, while in June 2024, it was Rs 616.70 Crore. The EPS for June 2025 was Rs 73.88, compared to Rs 71.13 in June 2024. The consolidated yearly financials reveal that the revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 6,846.80 Crore, up from Rs 6,704.63 Crore in March 2024. The net profit increased to Rs 2,379.60 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 2,219.36 Crore in March 2024. The EPS also rose from Rs 256.39 in March 2024 to Rs 274.27 in March 2025. title: Samvardhana Motherson International shares rise 2.04% in early trade
content: Shares of Samvardhana Motherson International gained 2.04% to trade at Rs 102.72 in early trade on Friday. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Next 50 index. Financial Snapshot Samvardhana Motherson International's financial performance reveals the following:Revenue: The company's consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 113,662.60 Crore, compared to Rs 98,691.70 Crore in the previous year.Net Profit: The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 3,618.20 Crore, a significant increase from Rs 2,782.00 Crore in the previous year.EPS: The Earnings Per Share (EPS) increased to Rs 5.50 for the year-ending March 2025, up from Rs 4.01 in the previous year.The following table summarizes the key financial figures:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)202157,369.901,157.803.29202263,536.00801.302.50202378,700.701,713.302.21202498,691.702,782.004.012025113,662.603,618.205.50The company has demonstrated consistent growth in revenue and profitability over the past five years. Sales for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 113,662 Crore, other income was at Rs 557 Crore and total income was Rs 114,220 Crore. Total expenditure for the same period was Rs 107,604 crore. The EBIT stood at Rs 6,616 Crore. Interest paid was Rs 1,882 Crore and tax was Rs 1,115 Crore. Quarterly Performance The consolidated quarterly financial performance shows:Revenue: The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 30,212.00 Crore.Net Profit: The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 481.82 Crore.EPS: The EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 0.48.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 202428,867.96989.121.47Sep 202427,811.86764.581.29Dec 202427,665.92881.191.25Mar 202529,316.83983.331.49Jun 202530,212.00481.820.48Sales for the quarter ending June 2025 were Rs 30,212 Crore, other income was Rs 80 Crore and total income was Rs 30,292 Crore. Total expenditure for the same period was Rs 29,119 crore. The EBIT stood at Rs 1,172 Crore. Interest paid was Rs 425 Crore and tax was Rs 265 Crore. Key Ratios As of March 2025, the company's Return on Networth / Equity (ROE) stood at 10.90% and ROCE was at 13.02%. The basic EPS stood at Rs 5.50. The company’s debt to equity ratio was 0.42.RatioMar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025Basic EPS (Rs.)3.292.502.214.015.50Book Value /Share (Rs.)52.5149.5035.9838.6049.57Return on Networth / Equity (%)8.274.246.6610.3810.90Debt to Equity (x)0.850.620.540.660.42Corporate Actions Samvardhana Motherson International announced a bonus issue on May 29, 2025, with a ratio of 1:2, the ex-bonus date was July 18, 2025. The company had earlier announced an interim dividend of Rs 0.50 per share (50%) which was effective from March 28, 2025 and a final dividend of Rs 0.35 per share (35%) which was effective from June 23, 2025. Samvardhana Motherson International Limited informed the exchange regarding completion of acquisition on September 9, 2025. The company also informed the exchange regarding schedule of fixed income investor meet to be held on September 12, 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 102.72, Samvardhana Motherson International shows a positive momentum in today's early trade.

title: Larsen & Toubro shares rise 0.67% in early trade today
content: Shares of Larsen & Toubro were trading at Rs 3,563.40 on the NSE, up 0.67% from the previous close, at 09:30 am on Friday. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. The consolidated revenue for Larsen & Toubro has shown consistent growth over the years. The annual revenue increased from Rs 135,979.03 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 255,734.45 Crore in March 2025. Similarly, the net profit rose from Rs 4,668.96 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 17,687.39 Crore in March 2025. The earnings per share (EPS) also increased from Rs 82.49 in March 2021 to Rs 109.36 in March 2025. Here is a summary of Larsen & Toubro's key financial data:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to EquityMar 2021135,979.034,668.9682.49625.9715.261.73Mar 2022156,521.2310,291.0561.71678.7910.521.50Mar 2023183,340.7012,624.8774.51736.8711.721.33Mar 2024221,112.9115,569.7293.96746.0115.121.32Mar 2025255,734.4517,687.39109.36710.1215.391.33The company’s quarterly performance also reflects growth. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,678.92 Crore, up from Rs 55,119.82 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period increased from Rs 3,440.11 Crore to Rs 4,325.57 Crore, and EPS increased from Rs 20.26 to Rs 26.30.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 202455,119.823,440.1120.26Sep 202461,554.584,112.8124.69Dec 202464,667.784,001.0324.43Mar 202574,392.286,133.4439.98Jun 202563,678.924,325.5726.30Larsen & Toubro has announced several dividends. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 34 per share on May 8, 2025, with an effective date of June 3, 2025. Earlier, a final dividend of Rs 28 per share was announced on May 8, 2024, effective June 20, 2024. The company has also issued bonus shares in the past. A bonus ratio of 1:2 was announced on May 29, 2017, with a record date of July 14, 2017, and an ex-bonus date of July 13, 2017. With the stock currently trading at Rs 3,563.40, Larsen & Toubro shows a positive trend in early trade.

title: Top midcap gainers: NLC India, Lupin, Supreme Industries stocks lead on Nifty Midcap 150 index today
content: At 9:30 am on Friday, several stocks were identified as top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150. NLC India led the gains at Rs 264.60, up by 3.25%. Other notable gainers included Lupin, Supreme Ind, Astral Ltd, and Bharat Forge. Financial Highlights of NLC India NLC India's financial performance shows a fluctuating but overall positive trend. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 15,282.96 Crore, compared to Rs 12,999.03 Crore in the previous year. Net profit also saw a significant increase, reaching Rs 2,713.37 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 1,867.32 Crore in March 2024. The company’s EPS stood at Rs 19.57.The company’s debt-to-equity ratio stood at 1.20. The following table summarizes the key financial figures for NLC India:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 9,846.09 CroreRs 11,947.94 CroreRs 16,165.24 CroreRs 12,999.03 CroreRs 15,282.96 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,345.37 CroreRs 1,115.13 CroreRs 1,425.13 CroreRs 1,867.32 CroreRs 2,713.37 CroreEPSRs 9.70Rs 8.05Rs 10.28Rs 13.47Rs 19.57BVPSRs 115.37Rs 118.09Rs 127.11Rs 139.66Rs 135.02ROE9.317.709.2011.2114.00Debt to Equity1.791.551.471.351.20NLC India's quarterly financial results indicate consistent revenue. The revenue for June 2025 stood at Rs 3,825.61 Crore, slightly down from Rs 3,836.00 Crore in March 2025. Net profit for the same period was Rs 839.15 Crore, up from Rs 468.36 Crore in the previous quarter. The EPS stood at Rs 5.02. The company’s financial performance demonstrates its ability to maintain profitability.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 3,376.05 CroreRs 3,657.27 CroreRs 4,411.41 CroreRs 3,836.00 CroreRs 3,825.61 CroreNet ProfitRs 566.64 CroreRs 982.40 CroreRs 695.95 CroreRs 468.36 CroreRs 839.15 CroreEPS4.097.715.023.385.02Corporate Announcements for NLC India Recent announcements from NLC India include the signing of a Memorandum of Understanding with Khanij Bidesh India Limited. Other announcements include appointment of Statutory Auditor and regarding Newspaper Publication. NLC India declared a final dividend of Rs 1.50 per share(15%) with effective date as 19 Sep, 2025. The company also announced an interim dividend of Rs 1.50 per share(15%) with effective date as 07 Feb, 2025. Financials of Lupin Lupin's consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 22,707.90 Crore, compared to Rs 20,010.82 Crore in the previous year. Net profit also saw a significant increase, reaching Rs 3,306.26 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 1,935.57 Crore in March 2024. The company’s EPS stood at Rs 71.95. The company's debt-to-equity ratio stood at 0.30.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 15,162.96 CroreRs 16,405.48 CroreRs 16,641.66 CroreRs 20,010.82 CroreRs 22,707.90 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,226.60 CroreRs -1,509.72 CroreRs 447.69 CroreRs 1,935.57 CroreRs 3,306.26 CroreEPSRs 26.84Rs -33.65Rs 9.46Rs 42.05Rs 71.95BVPSRs 305.45Rs 268.91Rs 275.67Rs 315.41Rs 376.77ROE8.81-12.573.4513.3919.07Debt to Equity0.220.320.340.190.30Lupin's quarterly financial results indicate increasing revenue. Hindalco was trading at Rs 750.75, up 1.09%. Maruti Suzuki and Hero Motocorp stocks were also among the top gainers on Nifty 50. Maruti Suzuki was trading at Rs 15,256.00, up 1.07%, while Hero Motocorp was trading at Rs 5,350.00, a 0.91% increase from its previous close. Axis Bank was also trading positively at Rs 1,095.80, a 0.77% gain from its previous close. title: Electric bus maker JBM Auto's shares soar 7 percent on IFC's largest e-mobility investment worth $100 million
content: Auto ancillary player and maker of electric buses, JBM Auto has bagged $100 million of long-term capital from International Financial Corporation (IFC) to finance the deployment of e-buses across Maharashtra, Assam and Gujarat, sending the shares higher by more than 7 percent in early trade on September 12. This is the largest ever e-bus deployment project undertaken by IFC, which is a World Bank Group entity, underscoring a rising interest to fund sustainable urban mobility projects. "It marks IFC’s first capital investment in the e-bus sector in Asia and its largest globally, strengthening urban transport resilience across Indian cities," said JBM Auto. The investment is expected to speed up e-bus deployment and enhance JBM’s edge in delivering sustainable mobility solutions, the auto OEM player said. JBM Auto has been deploying zero-emission public mobility solutions across cities in India and globally across Europe, Middle East, and the APAC region. Company's Vice Chairman and MD, Nishant Arya said the funding will help JBM Auto seek more such associations in the future. "With over 11,000 buses deployed and under execution, we are proud to have clocked 200+ Mn e-kms and served over 1 Bn passengers till date. With trusted partners like IFC, this initiative serves as a strategic beginning to many more upcoming associations towards augmenting e-bus deployment with enhanced agility and scale," Nishant Arya said. JBM Auto has an orderbook of Rs 12,900 crore as of August 2025, including 2,411 buses under PM e-Bus Sewa. Central government schemes such as PM e-Bus Sewa and PM E-DRIVE are aimign to deploy of over 52,000 e-buses across India by 2030, with a long-term plan for 1 lakh e-buses under the Bharat Urban Megabus Mission. "E-mobility is the future — and we are making it real through investments in leaders like JBM," Makhtar Diop, Managing Director, International Finance Corporation said, adding, "India’s leadership is accelerating its own transition while shaping how cities worldwide finance the next generation of mobility." In India, buses make up for 70-75% of public transport journeys via 20 lakh buses in operation, which JBM Auto said is a 'major opportunity' for electrification. India's e-bus market is growing rapidly and funding for such projects will be key to realise the target of 40% EV penetration by FY30. Industry estimates have pegged India's auto component market to reach $200 billion by 2030, growing at a CAGR of 16% from 2024. Exports are seen as a primary engine for this growth, seen rising as an annual rate of 30% to touch as much as $100 billion. This growth could surpass India's domestic OEM consumption, projected to rise to $89 billion by 2030.
summary_lexrank: "It marks IFC’s first capital investment in the e-bus sector in Asia and its largest globally, strengthening urban transport resilience across Indian cities," said JBM Auto.
summary_luhn: Central government schemes such as PM e-Bus Sewa and PM E-DRIVE are aimign to deploy of over 52,000 e-buses across India by 2030, with a long-term plan for 1 lakh e-buses under the Bharat Urban Megabus Mission.
summary_lsa: India's e-bus market is growing rapidly and funding for such projects will be key to realise the target of 40% EV penetration by FY30.
summary_textrank: Auto ancillary player and maker of electric buses, JBM Auto has bagged $100 million of long-term capital from International Financial Corporation (IFC) to finance the deployment of e-buses across Maharashtra, Assam and Gujarat, sending the shares higher by more than 7 percent in early trade on September 12.

title: Infosys shares jump 2% on higher-than-expected share buyback of Rs 18,000 crore
content: The shares of Infosys jumped more than 2 percent on September 12 after the board of India's second largest IT company approved a share buyback proposal worth Rs 18,000 crore, its largest ever. The shares were trading at Rs 1,539.90 apiece in the early hours of the session, as investors cheered higher than expected share buyback announcement. In an exchange filing released in the post market hours of September 11, Infosys announced that the share buyback program does not exceed 25 percent of the aggregate paid-up capital and accounts for 2.41 percent of the company. The buyback price has been set at Rs 1,800 per share. This is the first buyback of shares announced by Infosys since 2022, when the company had agreed to a buyback proposal of Rs 9,300 crore. The record date for the latest buyback programme is yet to be announced. A share buyback is a programme where a company buys back some of its shares from the existing shareholders. The buyback price of Rs 1,800 apiece is more than 19 percent higher than the stock's previous closing price of Rs 1,509.70 apiece. In an exchange filing released on September 12, Infosys said that it will receive some exemptive relief from the US SEC as a result of the share buyback due to "conflicting regulatory requirements between Indian and U.S. laws for tender offer buybacks". The Bengaluru-based IT major had cash and cash equivalents of over Rs 42,000 crore and free cash flow of over Rs 20,000 crore in FY25, giving it ample headroom for shareholder payouts. The buyback will be funded from its free reserves, in line with its capital allocation policy of returning 85 percent of free cash flow over five years through dividends and repurchases. Infosys shares gained more than 6 percent in the past five days, and over 8 percent in the past one month. The stock has fallen nearly 3 percent in the past six months, and is down more than 18 percent in 2025 so far. Should you buy, sell or hold? CLSA kept an 'Outperform' call on the stock, with a target price of Rs 1,861 apiece. This implies an upside potential of more than 23 percent from the stock's previous closing price. The buyback is expected to support stock price during the weak second half of FY26, it said. Nomura kept a 'Buy' call on the stock, with a target price of Rs 1,880 per share. This implies an upside potential of over 24 percent from the stock's previous closing price. The international brokerage expects the firm's CC revenue to grow 3.8 percent on-year in FY26. Morgan Stanley kept an 'Equal-weight' call on the stock, with a target price of Rs 1,700 per share. This implies an upside potential of nearly 13 percent from the stock's previous closing price. The international brokerage said that the firm's buyback size was higher than the Rs 10,000–14,000 crore size initially estimated. Amid macro uncertainty around Trump tariffs, Morgan Stanley sees the buyback as a vote of confidence in stability of FY26 guidance. In the first quarter of the ongoing financial year 2026, Infosys reported an 8.7 percent year-on-year rise in consolidated net profit to Rs 6,921 crore, beating expectations. Revenue for the quarter grew 7.5 percent on-year to Rs 42,279 crore. Infosys said it expects revenue growth of 1–3 percent in constant currency terms for FY26, revised up from 0-3 percent earlier. The firm maintained its operating margin guidance at 20–22 percent. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: The buyback price of Rs 1,800 apiece is more than 19 percent higher than the stock's previous closing price of Rs 1,509.70 apiece.
summary_luhn: In an exchange filing released in the post market hours of September 11, Infosys announced that the share buyback program does not exceed 25 percent of the aggregate paid-up capital and accounts for 2.41 percent of the company.
summary_lsa: Morgan Stanley kept an 'Equal-weight' call on the stock, with a target price of Rs 1,700 per share.
summary_textrank: In an exchange filing released in the post market hours of September 11, Infosys announced that the share buyback program does not exceed 25 percent of the aggregate paid-up capital and accounts for 2.41 percent of the company.

title: NBCC share price gain on project win worth Rs 3,700 crore
content: NBCC share price gained in the early trade on September 12 on winning infrastructure development projects near Jaipur International Airport. At 09:19 hrs NBCC (India) was quoting at Rs 108.96, up Rs 1.16, or 1.08 percent, on the BSE. ".... has signed a Memorandum of Understanding with Rajasthan State Industrial Development & Investment Corporation Limited (RIICO) for the development of the prestigious Rajasthan Mandapam and allied infrastructure projects near Jaipur International Airport, Tonk Road, Jaipur," company said in its press release. The project valued at approximately Rs 3,700 crore and targeted completion within 30 months upon receipt of statutory and internal approval.

title: Consolidated Construction shares surge 14% on orders win of Rs 180 crore
content: Consolidated Construction Consortium share price surged nearly 14 percent in the early trade on September 12 following the company received multiple order from various clients. At 09:21 hrs Consolidated Construction Consortium was quoting at Rs 21.10, up Rs 2.56, or 13.81 percent, on the BSE. The company's buildings & factories (B&F) vertical received multiple orders for constructing of buildings & factories to the extent of 13.5 lakh square feet. The aggregating value of the contract is Rs 180 crore and to be executed in the financial year 2025-26.

title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
content: Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty are likely to see a higher start on September 12, tracking GIFT Nifty, which was hovering around 25,186.50. Track the latest updates on GIFT Nifty right here on Moneycontrol. In yet another range-bound session on September 11, the Indian equity markets ended higher with Nifty finishing above 25,000 for the first time since August 21. The Nifty50 index extended its winning run on its 7th straight session, closing at 25,005.50, up 32.40 points or 0.13 percent, while BSE Sensex also extended its rally on its fourth day, closing at 81,548.73, up 123.58 points or 0.15 percent. Broader indices underperformed the main indices, with BSE Midcap and smallcap indices finishing on a flat note. Here is how financial markets across the globe fared overnight: GIFT Nifty (Rises) The GIFT Nifty is trading higher at around 25,186.50, indicating a positive opening start for the day. Asian Equities (Up) Asia joined a global equity rally after relatively tame US inflation data and cooling jobs numbersclinched a path for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates next week. US Equities (Gain) Wall Street's main indexes notched record-high closes on Thursday, following gains in Tesla and Micron Technology. Meanwhile, U.S. inflation and jobless data fueled expectations that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates this month. US consumer prices rose more than expected in August, and the annual increase in inflation was the largest in seven months. The S&P 500 climbed 0.85% to end the session at 6,587.47 points. The Nasdaq gained 0.72% to 22,043.08 points, while the Dow rose 1.36% to 46,108.00 points US Bond Yield (Mixed) The yield on 10-year Treasuries was up marginally, while 2-year Treasuries were down marginally on growing expectations for interest rate cuts. Dollar Index (Up) The dollar index is trading with marginal gains against the other major currencies in the early trade on Friday. Asian currencies (Mixed) Asian currencies were trading mostly higher in the early trade on Friday, with the Malaysian Ringgit leading the gainers, followed by the Philippines Peso, Taiwan Dollar, Indonesian Rupiah, and Thai Baht Crude (Slips) Oil held a decline after the International Energy Agency projected an even bigger surplus next year, with the bearish outlook offsetting concerns about geopolitical tensions from the Middle East to Europe. Fund Flow Action The Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) offloaded equities worth Rs 3472 crore on September 11, while Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) bought equities worth Rs 4045 crore on the same day. title: Asia joins global equity rally after US inflation
content: Asia joined a global equity rally after relatively tame US inflation data and cooling jobs numbers clinched a path for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates next week. MSCI’s gauge of Asian shares rose for a seventh day and neared a fresh record, after the S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100 indexes both climbed to fresh closing highs in New York. A gauge of global stocks also hit a new record. Contracts for US equities were little changed Friday. Microsoft Corp. shares climbed in post-market trading after the tech giant and OpenAI said they had reached an agreement, while Adobe Inc. shares also advanced in extended trading after it gave a strong quarterly revenue outlook. Elsewhere, Hyundai Motor Co. said a battery plant that was raided by US immigration authorities is being delayed as the companies faced labor shortages. US consumer price index data showed core prices that strip out food and energy rose 0.3% in August and 3.1% from a year earlier, in line with economists forecasts. Alongside that report came jobless-claims figures, which jumped to the highest in almost four years, emboldening bets policymakers will lower rates at its Sept. 16-17 meeting in an effort to counter a rapid slowdown in the labor market. “Inflation is relatively calm, which gives the Fed the flexibility to focus more on stemming ongoing weakness in the labor market,” said Skyler Weinand at Regan Capital. “We expect the Fed to cut 25 basis points next week and to follow through with another two 25 basis-point cuts this year.” Treasuries broadly held on to gains made on Thursday when the US 10-year yield fell two basis points. Australian and New Zealand yields fell Friday, echoing the move. Bloomberg’s index of the dollar was steady. Gold stabilized after a small Thursday decline after eclipsing its inflation-adjusted peak set in 1980. In Asia, data on the docket for release includes industrial production for Japan and inflation for India. Money supply and new loans data for China may be released any time through Sept. 15. In China, investors will be closely watching the Hong Kong-listed shares in Alibaba Group Holdings Ltd. after the company’s US-listed depositary receipts rallied 8% Thursday. Elsewhere, oil fell for a second day as a worsening market outlook undercut concerns about potential geopolitical disruptions to supplies. US Rate Cuts A slowing US jobs market has prompted markets to price a more aggressive trajectory of policy easing. Swaps pricing indicates traders anticipate the equivalent of between two or three 25 basis point cuts through year-end. “Right now, inflation is a key subplot, but the labor market is still the main story,” said Ellen Zentner at Morgan Stanley Wealth Management. Thursday’s “CPI may appear to offset yesterday’s PPI, but it wasn’t hot enough to distract the Fed from the softening jobs picture. That translates into a rate cut next week — and, likely, more to come.” While there may be some murmurs within the Fed about the need for a 50 basis-point cut, an emergency-sized reduction is not required, said Seema Shah at Principal Asset Management. Jobless claims are still quite low compared to 2021 levels, while the broader economic activity data and earnings reports do not signal the US is approaching a recessionary tipping point.
summary_lexrank: MSCI’s gauge of Asian shares rose for a seventh day and neared a fresh record, after the S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100 indexes both climbed to fresh closing highs in New York.
summary_luhn: That translates into a rate cut next week — and, likely, more to come.” While there may be some murmurs within the Fed about the need for a 50 basis-point cut, an emergency-sized reduction is not required, said Seema Shah at Principal Asset Management.
summary_lsa: Elsewhere, Hyundai Motor Co. said a battery plant that was raided by US immigration authorities is being delayed as the companies faced labor shortages.

title: Stocks to Watch Today: Infosys, Canara Bank, LODHA, Bharat Forge, NBCC, JBM Auto, Marico, GMR Power, RailTel, Prostarm Info, Travel Food in focus on 11 September
content: Let's catch up on the latest news from the stock market. From significant investments to major deals, order wins, acquisitions, appointments, and fund raising, here’s a quick look at which stocks will be in focus in today's trade: Results Today Gem AromaticsSugs Lloyd Stocks to Watch Infosys The Board has approved a proposal to buy back equity shares worth Rs 18,000 crore at Rs 1,800 per share, comprising the purchase of 10 crore shares (2.41% stake). Additionally, the company announced a strategic alliance with NYSE-listed HanesBrands Inc, a global leader in everyday iconic apparel. Under this ten-year engagement, the company will serve as HanesBrands’ strategic collaborator across their digital, business applications, and data landscape. Canara Bank Canara Robeco Asset Management Company, a subsidiary of Canara Bank, has received an observation letter from the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) dated September 10, for filing the Red Herring Prospectus (RHP) to float an IPO. Lodha Developers The real estate developer has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) worth Rs 30,000 crore with Lodha Developers for setting up a data centre park in Palava. Combined investments of over Rs 30,000 crore are anticipated from Lodha and various data centre players in this park. Bharat Forge The company has signed an MoU with Windracers, the UK-based manufacturer of dual-use heavy-lift drones, to collaborate on the deployment, localisation, and application of Windracers ULTRA Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) across India. Additionally, Abu Dhabi–based MP3 International, a GRADEONE subsidiary, has signed an agreement with Kalyani Strategic Systems, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Bharat Forge, for the supply of artillery system critical spare parts to the UAE. Consolidated Construction Consortium The company has bagged orders worth Rs 180 crore from various clients under the buildings and factories division during the period July 12–September 11. With this, the order backlog stands at Rs 652 crore. NBCC India The company has signed an MoU with Rajasthan State Industrial Development & Investment Corporation (RIICO) for the development of Rajasthan Mandapam and allied infrastructure projects near Jaipur International Airport. The project is valued at Rs 3,700 crore. JBM Auto The company’s subsidiary JBM Ecolife Mobility has secured a $100 million long-term capital investment from the International Finance Corporation (IFC). The investment will finance the deployment of modern, air-conditioned electric buses across cities in Maharashtra, Assam, and Gujarat. JSW Infrastructure The company, through its subsidiary JSW Port Logistics, has announced the acquisition of a brownfield rail siding for Rs 57 crore in Ballari (Karnataka). The site spans over 86 acres and was previously owned by Hothur Ispat. Marico The company has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire the remaining 46.02% stake in HW Wellness Solutions (owner of the brand True Elements) from its founders and other shareholders for Rs 138 crore. On May 23, 2022, the company had acquired 53.98% stake in HW Wellness, thereby making it a subsidiary. Cohance Lifesciences The United States Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) conducted a general current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMP) audit at the company’s API manufacturing facility (API Unit-1) at Jaggaiahpet, Andhra Pradesh, from September 8–11, which concluded with zero Form 483 observations. State Bank of India The Financial Services Institutions Bureau (FSIB) has recommended Ravi Ranjan as the new Managing Director of SBI. Mahindra and Mahindra The company’s subsidiary, Mahindra Holdings, has acquired the entire stake from Prudential Management & Services in Mahindra & Mahindra Contech and PSL Media & Communications. Following the acquisition, both Mahindra & Mahindra Contech and PSL Media will become direct subsidiaries of Mahindra Holdings. GMR Power and Urban Infra The Supreme Court has dismissed the civil appeals filed by the Distribution Licensees of Haryana and GRID Corporation of Odisha (GRIDCO). The court upheld the Tribunal’s judgment dated December 20, 2019, confirming GMR Kamalanga Energy’s position that linkage coal is to be allocated on a pro-rata basis among the project beneficiaries. JSW Energy The company has successfully commissioned 317 MW of renewable energy capacity, comprising 240 MW hydro, 34 MW solar, and 43 MW wind, taking the total installed capacity to 13.097 GW. Travel Food Services The company has received a Letter of Award for the setup, operations, maintenance, and management of food and beverage outlets, lounge, and bar at the Domestic Terminal (T1) of Cochin International Airport. Indian Overseas Bank The bank has reduced the Marginal Cost of Funds-based Lending Rate (MCLR) by 5 basis points in the overnight, one-year, two-year, and three-year tenors, effective September 15, while keeping the one-month, three-month, and six-month tenors unchanged. RailTel Corporation of India The company has received a work order worth Rs 32.51 crore from Panvel Municipal Corporation, and another project worth Rs 70.94 crore from Nashik Municipal Smart City Development Corporation. JTL Industries Atul Garg has resigned as Chief Financial Officer of the company, effective September 11. The Board has appointed Naveen Kumar Laroiya as the new CFO, effective the same date. NLC India The company has signed an MoU with Khanij Bidesh India to collaborate in the identification, acquisition, and development of critical and strategic mineral projects on a global scale. Hemant Surgical Industries The company has received a purchase order from the Central Medical Services Society, Ministry of Health, for the supply of ultraportable handheld X-ray machines and related utilities worth Rs 82.89 crore. Arihant Foundations & Housing The Board will meet on September 16 to consider and approve raising funds through debentures. Prostarm Info Systems The company has received a Letter of Intent for a contract worth Rs 158.68 crore from the Director General of Police, Maharashtra State, for the supply and maintenance of CCTNS IT infrastructure and peripherals across Maharashtra police establishments. Stanley Lifestyles The company has decided to revise prices of its products across the Sofas & More retail format, effective September 12. The price decrease is primarily in anticipation of the upcoming festive season. Bulk Deals Bajel Projects HDFC Mutual Fund continued to be a seller in Bajel Projects, the power transmission and distribution infrastructure services provider, for the second consecutive session, offloading 21,96,288 shares (1.9% stake) for Rs 42.86 crore. title: Dr. Reddy's acquires J&J's Stugeron brand for $50.5 million
content: Dr. Reddy's Laboratories Ltd. on Thursday said it has acquired the STUGERON® brand portfolio from Janssen Pharmaceutica NV, an affiliate of Johnson & Johnson, for $50.5 million. The definitive transaction, announced Thursday, gives Dr. Reddy's access to Stugeron and its related brands, including Stugeron Forte and Stugeron Plus, across 18 markets in the Asia-Pacific (APAC) and Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA) regions, with India and Vietnam as key markets. The acquisition is a strategic move to strengthen Dr. Reddy's Central Nervous System (CNS) portfolio and expand into the anti-vertigo segment. The company noted that Stugeron already holds the top position in the cinnarizine pharmaceutical market and is ranked second in the anti-vertigo extended pharmaceutical market in India. Dr. Reddy's stated that the operations of the acquired business will be gradually transitioned to ensure smooth integration. The company's CEO of Branded Markets, M.V. Ramana, said the deal "reflects a steady advancement in our efforts" and aligns with the company's goal of reaching over 1.5 billion patients by 2030.

title: HDFC Mutual Fund remains seller in Bajel Projects for second day, offloads 1.9% stake
content: HDFC Mutual Fund continued to be seller in Bajel Projects, the power transmission and distribution infrastructure services provider, for the second consecutive session, offloading 1.9 percent via open market transactions on September 11. The stock corrected 0.83 percent to close at Rs 193.36 amid high volumes, extending downtrend for sixth consecutive session and trading below all key moving averages. Overall it has been under pressure since July, falling nearly 27 percent from July swing high of Rs 263.9. HDFC Mutual Fund sold 9,46,288 equity shares in Bajel Projects, which was earlier a part of Bajaj Electricals, at Rs 195.25 per share, and 12.5 lakh shares at Rs 195.14 per share. The total 21,96,288 shares (equivalent to 1.9 percent) sold in the open market by the mutual fund house were worth Rs 42.86 crore. In the previous session, HDFC Mutual Fund had offloaded 18,93,098 shares (1.63 percent stake) valued at Rs 36.9 crore percent, taking the total stake to 3.53 percent sold by the AMC in the company in last two consecutive sessions. HDFC Asset Management Company through its Small Cap Fund held 58,31,624 shares (5.04 percent stake) in Bajel Projects as of June 2025. The profitability of the company was impacted in quarter ended June 2025 partly due to lower other income and higher finance cost. Profit fell by 46.5 percent to Rs 2.95 crore in Q1FY26, down from Rs 5.5 crore in the same period last year. Revenue increased by 18.7 percent year-on-year to Rs 607.6 crore in the same period. On the operating front, EBITDA surged 133.2 percent to Rs 16.55 crore, increasing from Rs 7.1 crore, with margin expanding by 134 bps to 2.72 percent in Q1FY26.

title: Gujarat Fluorochemicals shares fall up to 5% after gas leak at Gujarat plant kills one, injures few
content: The shares of Gujarat Fluorochemicals dropped nearly 5 percent intraday on September 11 after the company announced that a gas leak at its plant in Gujarat's Ranjitnagar has caused one death and few injuries. The firm said it is working to restart operations at the plant. In an exchange filing, Gujarat Fluorochemicals said a minor rupture at one of the bellows in the gas pipeline led to a temporary gas leak at the plant. "The situation was instantly brought under control through the plant’s safety mechanisms," the firm said, adding that sprinklers were activated, and the DSC control system safely halted plant operations. All personnel were immediately evacuated from the affected area, it added. The workers who were potentially exposed to the gas leak were administered immediate first-aid at the site and few were shifted to nearby hospitals, the firm said. "We regret to report that one casualty and a few injuries have been recorded. While the post-mortem report is awaited, prima facie it appears to be during the rush of evacuation process. We deeply regret this incident and the loss of life. Our thoughts and condolences are with the bereaved family, and we are extending our full support during this difficult time," it added. Gujarat Fluorochemicals is conducting a detailed investigation and continues to prioritize the highest standards of safety across all its operations, it said. The damage and losses incurred for disruption of production is covered under its insurance policy, the company in its exchange filing added. "Workers who complained of nausea after the gas leak were immediately given the antidote at the on-site Occupational Health Centre and referred to the hospital. One person has died in the incident. The people living in nearby villages should not panic," DSP Hareshbhai Dudhat told ANI.#WATCH | Gujarat | One person has died in toxic gas leak at Gujarat Fluorochemicals Limited in Ranjitnagar village, Panchmahal district DSP Hareshbhai Dudhat says, "We got information of a gas leak at Gujarat Fluorochemicals Limited at 12.10 pm today. Workers who complained of… pic.twitter.com/rHwlZQp9ni — ANI (@ANI) September 10, 2025 Gujarat Fluorochemicals shares recovered some losses to close 3 percent lower at Rs 3,620.90 apiece. The shares have gained nearly 7 percent in the past five days, but have fallen more than 14 percent in 2025 so far.
