title: Taking Stock: Nifty closes above 25,000, Sensex rises 123 pts; oil & gas, power stocks gain, IT falls
content: In yet another rangebound session on September 11, the Indian equity markets ended higher with Nifty finishing above 25,000 for the first time since August 21. The Nifty50 index extended the winning run on 7th straight session, closing at 25,005.50, up 32.40 points or 0.13 percent, while BSE Sensex also extend rally on fourth day, closing at 81,548.73, up 123.58 points or 0.15 percent. Broader indices underperformed the man indices with BSE Midcap and smallcap indices finishing on flat note. Also Read - First tranche of India-US trade agreement likely by November 2025: Piyush Goyal Adani Enterprises, Shriram Finance, NTPC, Axis Bank, Power Grid were among major gainers on the Nifty, while losers were Bajaj Auto, Infosys, SBI Life Insurance, Wipro, Titan Company. On the sectoral front, energy, PSU Bank, pharma, oil & gas, media up 0.5-1%, while IT index declined 0.5%, auto index shed 0.3%. Also Read: India plans to retain market borrowing target after tax cuts In stock-specific action, SpiceJet shares rose 2% on securing $89.5 million liquidity boost through Carlyle settlement, Jupitar Wagons shares added 4% on order win worth Rs 113 crore, ACME Solar shares jumped 3% on securing Rs 3,892 crore project funding for 400 MW FDRE project from SBI, Gujarat Fluorochemicals shares down 3% on gas leak incidence at Ranjitnagar plant. Kalpataru Projects shares added 2.4% on bagging orders worth RS 2,720 crore, Infosys shares ended 1.4% lower ahead of board meeting for buyback, Adani Power shares down 1.5% despite receiving LoA from MPPMCL, Tega Industries shares fell 2% on firm planning to acquire Molycop in consortium with Apollo Funds. More than 100 stocks touched their 52-week highs on the BSE, including Waaree Energies, Zydus Wellness, Indian Bank, Fortis Healthcare, Gujarat Mineral, among others. Click to View More Outlook for September 12 Ajit Mishra – SVP, Research, Religare Broking Markets traded in a subdued manner on Thursday and ended marginally higher, taking a breather after the recent surge. After a positive start, the Nifty moved in a narrow range throughout the session and finally settled at 25,005.5 level. Sectoral performance was mixed, with energy and pharma emerging as top gainers, while IT and auto witnessed profit booking. Meanwhile, the broader indices remained largely flat, underperforming the large-cap space. It appears that markets have absorbed the initial reaction to favorable developments such as GST reforms and optimism around US–India trade talks, and may now witness a brief pause. However, rotational buying across key sectors and early signs of a reversal in themes like defense and railways are likely to keep the undertone positive. Amid this backdrop, we continue to advocate a “buy on dips” strategy in the index and suggest focusing on accumulating quality names across sectors and themes that are moving in line with the benchmark. Nagaraj Shetti, Senior Technical Research Analyst at HDFC Securities The upmove with range bound action continued in the market on Thursday and Nifty closed the day with modest gains of 30 points. After opening on a negative note, the market recovered initially but later shifted into a usual small range movement and that continued till the end. A small positive candle was formed on the daily chart with minor upper shadow. Technically this action signals a range bound action in the market. Though, Nifty placed at the crucial hurdle of 25000 mark (down sloping trend line and previous two weeks highs) but not showing any strength to witness a decisive break out of the hurdle. The recent opening upside gap of 9th and 10th Sept remains unfilled. The underlying trend of Nifty remains positive with choppy movement. Any failure to move sharply above the important resistance of 25000-25100 levels in the next 1-2 sessions could open short term weakness in the market. Immediate support is at 24800. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decision.
summary_lexrank: The underlying trend of Nifty remains positive with choppy movement.
summary_luhn: The Nifty50 index extended the winning run on 7th straight session, closing at 25,005.50, up 32.40 points or 0.13 percent, while BSE Sensex also extend rally on fourth day, closing at 81,548.73, up 123.58 points or 0.15 percent.
summary_lsa: More than 100 stocks touched their 52-week highs on the BSE, including Waaree Energies, Zydus Wellness, Indian Bank, Fortis Healthcare, Gujarat Mineral, among others.
summary_textrank: Nagaraj Shetti, Senior Technical Research Analyst at HDFC Securities The upmove with range bound action continued in the market on Thursday and Nifty closed the day with modest gains of 30 points.

title: Tata Investment Corp shares jump 3% as report says Tata Capital aiming to launch mega IPO in October
content: The shares of Tata Investment Corporation jumped nearly 3 percent intraday after a report said that Tata Capital is set to launch its IPO to raise around $2 billion (around Rs 17,688 crore) by early October. Tata Capital is preparing to launch its IPO in the first half of October after asking Reserve Bank of India for a short extension to the launch timetable, Bloomberg reported citing people familiar with the matter. This comes after RBI told "upper layer" NBFCs to list by September 2025. Tata Capital Financial Services, which merged with Tata Capital in January 2024, is on the regulator's list. Tata Capital is likely wrap up its IPO roadshows this week and file its second draft red herring prospectus soon, the report further said. Moneycontrol couldn't independently verify the report. Earlier in April this year, Moneycontrol reported that the N Chandrasekaran-led diversified conglomerate Tata Group has filed papers with SEBI for a mega Rs 15,000-crore plus initial public offer (IPO) of the group's flagship financial services arm Tata Capital via the confidential pre-filing route. Tata Capital is a non-banking financial services (NBFC) firm and a subsidiary of the business group's principal investment holding company, Tata Sons. "The draft papers have been filed with the market regulator through the confidential pre-filing route. The issue will be a combination of combination of primary and secondary issue of shares, Tata Sons and investor IFC will pare stake, with greater participation from the former " one of the persons above said. On February 25, the Tata Capital board approved the IPO plan and said it will comprise a fresh issue of up to 230 million shares and an offer for sale of equity shares by its existing shareholders. The IPO is subject to market conditions, and regulatory clearances, the company said. As on March 31, 2024, Tata Sons directly owned 92.83 per cent in Tata Capital Limited while the balance stake was held by other Tata Group entities and IFC. Tata Investment Corporation shares jumped nearly 3 percent to hit an intraday high of Rs 6,990 apiece. The stock later pared some gains to close 1.4 percent higher at Rs 6,857 apiece. Its P/E ratio currently stands at 159.27. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates
summary_lexrank: Tata Capital is a non-banking financial services (NBFC) firm and a subsidiary of the business group's principal investment holding company, Tata Sons.
summary_luhn: The shares of Tata Investment Corporation jumped nearly 3 percent intraday after a report said that Tata Capital is set to launch its IPO to raise around $2 billion (around Rs 17,688 crore) by early October.
summary_lsa: Tata Investment Corporation shares jumped nearly 3 percent to hit an intraday high of Rs 6,990 apiece.
summary_textrank: Tata Capital is preparing to launch its IPO in the first half of October after asking Reserve Bank of India for a short extension to the launch timetable, Bloomberg reported citing people familiar with the matter.

title: Two Adani group stocks fall up to 1% amid large trade deals
content: Shares of Ambuja Cements and Adani Power came under pressure on Thursday, falling over 1 percent after large block deals on the exchanges. According to CNBC-TV18, about 2.8 crore shares, representing 1.2 percent equity of Ambuja Cements, changed hands at Rs 552 apiece. The stock later ended nearly 1 percent lower at Rs 560.55 on the NSE. Adani Power slipped as much as 5.4 percent to an intraday low of Rs 600 following a block deal executed at a discount to the previous closing price. The stock recovered part of its losses and settled at Rs 626.4, down 1.27 percent. Exchange data showed that more than 3.7 crore shares of Adani Power were traded in opening deals at an average price of Rs 608.35 per share, a discount of over 4 percent to Wednesday’s close of Rs 634.45. Adani Power announced plans to invest Rs 21,000 crore to set up a 1.6 gigawatt ultra-supercritical thermal power project in Anuppur district of Madhya Pradesh. The company said it has secured a letter of award from MP Power Management Co for the supply of 1.6 GW and will establish two units of 800 MW each under the design, build, finance, own and operate model. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Bharti Airtel shares gain 1.03%, stock among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were among the top gainers on the Nifty 50, rising 1.03% to Rs 1,910.80 at 3:10 pm. The company's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth. Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 49,462.60 Crore, compared to Rs 47,876.20 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025, marking an increase. Net profit for the same period was Rs 7,339.00 Crore, down from Rs 12,418.10 Crore in the previous quarter. Looking at the annual results, Bharti Airtel's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 172,985.20 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 149,982.40 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 33,778.30 Crore, significantly higher compared to Rs 5,848.60 Crore in the previous year.Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs.)BVPS (Rs.)ROE (%)Debt to EquityMar 2025172,985.2033,778.3058.00226.1625.581.13Mar 2024149,982.405,848.6013.09216.407.391.50Mar 2023139,144.8011,535.3014.80210.959.191.82Mar 2022116,546.905,882.007.67164.466.392.00Mar 2021100,615.80-23,327.90-27.65147.90-25.582.20Bharti Airtel announced a final dividend of Rs 16.00 per share (320%) on May 13, 2025, with the effective date being July 18, 2025. Earlier dividends include Rs 8.00 per share (160%) declared on May 14, 2024, and Rs 4.00 per share (80%) on May 16, 2023. The company has also made several announcements under Regulation 30 of SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, regarding analyst/investor meets and newspaper publications related to the transfer of equity shares and unclaimed/unpaid dividends to the Investor Education Protection Fund (IEPF). According to a Moneycontrol analysis on September 5, 2025, the sentiment surrounding the stock is neutral. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 1,910.80, Bharti Airtel is currently among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index.

title: Aurobindo Pharm among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150; shares rise 5.57%
content: Aurobindo Pharm shares rose 5.57% on Thursday and were among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150. The stock was trading at Rs 1,108.80 at 3:00 pm. NHPC and Gland were also among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150, rising 3.19% and 3.11% respectively. Financial Performance Aurobindo Pharm's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 7,868.14 Crore, compared to Rs 8,382.12 Crore in March 2025. The net profit for the same period was Rs 822.28 Crore, compared to Rs 935.02 Crore in the previous quarter. The company’s consolidated yearly revenue has shown consistent growth, reaching Rs 31,723.73 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, up from Rs 29,001.87 Crore in the previous year. Net profit also increased to Rs 3,515.26 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 3,186.13 Crore in March 2024. title: PSU bank stocks gain for 2nd day on consolidation buzz; PNB, Canara Bank, others rise up to 2%
content: The shares of several public sector banks (PSB) rose on September 11, pushing the Nifty PSU Bank index higher into the green in the afternoon. This comes as reports on further consolidation of these lenders boosted investor sentiment. The Nifty PSU Bank index rose nearly 1 percent to 7,089, extending gains for the second consecutive session. The government is expected to revisit the consolidation plans of these PSBs in an effort to create larger and more globally competitive lenders, The Economic Times reported on September 10, citing sources. The issue will be taken up at the upcoming PSB Manthan which is scheduled to begin tomorrow, it added. The last major round of restructuring in 2019-2020 had brought down the number of state-run lenders from 27 to 12. A senior official told ET that while there is a recognized need for Indian banks to scale up globally, any new round of consolidation will depend on synergies and consultations with the lenders themselves. The aim would be to form at least three to four very large banks, it added. ET further reported that the two-day summit will also include discussions between PSBs and key infrastructure financing entities such as the National Bank for Financing Infrastructure and Development (NaBFID) and India Infrastructure Finance Company (IIFCL). Moneycontrol couldn't independently verify the report. Punjab National Bank (PNB) and Canara Bank shares were the top gainers on the index, rising nearly 2 percent each. UCO Bank, Punjab & Sind Bank (PSB), Bank of Maharashtra and Bank of India shares rose more than 1 percent each. Union Bank of India, Central Bank of India and State Bank of India (SBI) shares rose nearly 1 percent each, while Indian Bank, Bank of Baroda and Indian Overseas Bank shares were hovering in the green with marginal gains. As of the June quarter, four public sector banks, which are UCO Bank, Indian Overseas Bank, Punjab & Sind Bank, and Central Bank of India, had government shareholding levels exceeding 90 percent. In 2019, the government initiated a large-scale consolidation drive in the PSU banking space, merging 10 public sector lenders into four larger entities. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

summary_luhn: Union Bank of India, Central Bank of India and State Bank of India (SBI) shares rose nearly 1 percent each, while Indian Bank, Bank of Baroda and Indian Overseas Bank shares were hovering in the green with marginal gains.
summary_lsa: A senior official told ET that while there is a recognized need for Indian banks to scale up globally, any new round of consolidation will depend on synergies and consultations with the lenders themselves.
summary_textrank: Union Bank of India, Central Bank of India and State Bank of India (SBI) shares rose nearly 1 percent each, while Indian Bank, Bank of Baroda and Indian Overseas Bank shares were hovering in the green with marginal gains.

title: Buy Coal India; target of Rs 450: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Coal India India’s total installed power capacity reached ~490GW as of Jul’25, grew at 7.8% CAGR over the past 15 years. Renewable energy (~237 GW, 49% share) has surpassed thermal capacity (~220 GW, 44% share), where RE and thermal grew at 10.9% and 6.5% CAGR, respectively, over the past 15 years. Despite decarbonization efforts, coal remains a critical source for India’s power demand, contributing ~65-75% of power generation. Therefore, with rising industrial/household activity, coal demand is expected to remain firm. Coal India (COAL) accounts for over ~70% of the total coal production in India (including captives/others), of which over 80% is supplied to the power sector, positioning it as a dominant player in the coal mining space. COAL’s earnings are expected to remain under pressure in FY26, driven by a lack of volume growth amid muted power demand as well as the rising share of captive/merchant mining during Apr-Jul’25. Moreover, subdued global coal prices will continue to cap COAL’s e-auction prices/demand. Outlook At CMP, the stock is trading at 4x on FY27E EV/EBITDA at its 10-year historical average. We reiterate our BUY rating with a TP of INR450/share, valuing the stock at 4.5x FY27E EV/EBITDA. summary_luhn: Coal India (COAL) accounts for over ~70% of the total coal production in India (including captives/others), of which over 80% is supplied to the power sector, positioning it as a dominant player in the coal mining space.

title: Buy CESC; target of Rs 195: Mirae Asset Sharekhan
content: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's research report on CESC CESC in its investor day presented its Vision 2030. The company intends to double the PAT by then. Company has strong capex plans of over Rs. 32,000 crore till FY30, with Rs. 23,000 crore for renewables, Rs. 6,000 crore for distribution and Rs. 3,000 crore for developing a 3GW cell & module manufacturing capacity. The growth plan includes pursuing new distribution licenses in UP and other areas and turnaround in Malegaon DF. Outlook We retain Buy on CESC with an unchanged PT of Rs. 195 on a SOTP basis. Renewable energy capex, new distribution license wins would drive the growth and turnaround of the existing distribution business would further aid the earnings. title: Avanti Feeds, Welspun Living, other shrimp & textile stocks drop up to 4% after sharp gains on India-US trade talks hopes
content: The shares of several export-oriented shrimp feed and textile companies dropped in trade on September 11 (Thursday). This comes as investors may have resorted to profit booking, a day after the stocks recorded massive gains. The stocks had seen significant surge on September 10 (Wednesday) after US President Donald Trump said Washington and New Delhi will resume negotiations to resolve the ongoing trade frictions. Apex Frozen Foods shares dropped over 4 percent to trade at Rs 246.28 apiece in the morning, while those of Avanti Feeds plunged 4 percent to trade at Rs 728.60 apiece. The two stocks had rallied 17 percent and 15 percent respectively yesterday. Among the textile stocks, Welspun Living shares dropped over 2 percent to trade at Rs 122.50 apiece. Raymond Lifestyle shares meanwhile fell nearly 2 percent to trade at Rs 1,286 apiece. The stocks had jumped 10 percent and 2 percent respectively the previous day. In a social media post on Truth Social, Trump announced, "I am pleased to announce that India, and the United States of America, are continuing negotiations to address the Trade Barriers between our two Nations." "I look forward to speaking with my very good friend, Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in the upcoming weeks. I feel certain that there will be no difficulty in coming to a successful conclusion for both of our Great Countries!" he further wrote. The shares of these export-oriented companies had significantly declined earlier after the Trump administration increased tariffs on Indian imports to a whopping 50 percent, citing New Delhi's continued purchase of Russian oil. However, Trump's latest comment may have boosted investor sentiment on the possibility of the two countries concluding their long-awaited tariff deal. Additionally, the US Supreme Court has agreed to decide the legality of Donald Trump's sweeping global tariffs. This comes after a lower court ruled that Trump’s tariffs were illegal. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Dr Reddys Labs, Tech Mahindra, Infosys shares among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Dr Reddys Labs, Tech Mahindra, and Infosys were among the top losers on the Nifty 50 in Thursday's trading session. At 10:30 am, Dr Reddys Labs was trading at Rs 1,288.10, a 1.23% decline from its previous close. Tech Mahindra was at Rs 1,508.10, down by 1.17%, while Infosys was trading at Rs 1,517.40, a decrease of 0.99%. Hero Motocorp and Wipro were also among the laggards, with declines of 0.94% and 0.75%, respectively. Dr Reddys Labs Financials The consolidated revenue for Dr Reddys Labs for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 13,351.20 Crore, compared to Rs 13,005.50 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 1,128.30 Crore, while in June 2024, it was Rs 862.20 Crore. The EPS for June 2025 was Rs 12.87, up from Rs 9.62 in June 2024. The company's annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 52,988.30 Crore, up from Rs 51,995.50 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 4,244.40 Crore, compared to Rs 2,386.30 Crore in March 2024. The EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 48.00, an increase from Rs 26.66 in March 2024. Tech Mahindra Financials Tech Mahindra's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 42,279.00 Crore, compared to Rs 39,315.00 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 6,924.00 Crore and Rs 6,374.00 Crore, respectively. The EPS stood at Rs 16.70 in June 2025, up from Rs 15.38 in June 2024. For the year-ending March 2025, Tech Mahindra reported revenue of Rs 162,990.00 Crore, compared to Rs 153,670.00 Crore in March 2024. The net profit increased to Rs 26,750.00 Crore from Rs 26,248.00 Crore. The EPS also rose from Rs 63.39 to Rs 64.50. Infosys Financials Infosys reported consolidated revenue of Rs 9,727.75 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2025, compared to Rs 10,210.79 Crore in June 2024. Net profit was Rs 1,076.21 Crore, slightly lower than Rs 1,086.35 Crore in the same quarter of the previous year. EPS, however, increased significantly from Rs 52.31 to Rs 85.26. The annual revenue for Infosys for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 40,923.42 Crore, up from Rs 37,788.62 Crore in March 2024. The net profit also increased from Rs 3,862.41 Crore to Rs 4,536.93 Crore. The EPS rose from Rs 187.36 to Rs 218.96. Hero Motocorp Financials Hero Motocorp's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 22,134.60 Crore, compared to Rs 21,963.80 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 3,331.50 Crore, up from Rs 3,041.10 Crore in June 2024. The EPS for June 2025 was Rs 3.18, up from Rs 5.75 in June 2024. Hero Motocorp's annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 89,088.40 Crore, down from Rs 89,760.30 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 13,192.60 Crore, compared to Rs 11,135.40 Crore in March 2024. The EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 12.56, down from Rs 20.89 in March 2024. Wipro Financials Wipro's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 9,727.75 Crore, compared to Rs 10,210.79 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 1,076.21 Crore, down from Rs 1,086.35 Crore in June 2024. The EPS for June 2025 was Rs 85.26, up from Rs 52.31 in June 2024. Wipro's annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 40,923.42 Crore, up from Rs 37,788.62 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 4,536.93 Crore, up from Rs 3,862.41 Crore in March 2024. The EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 218.96, up from Rs 187.36 in March 2024. Shares of Dr Reddys Labs, Tech Mahindra, and Infosys were among the top losers on the Nifty 50 in Thursday's trading session.

title: Eternal, Adani Ports stocks among top gainers on Nifty 50 in today's trading
content: At 10:30 am on Thursday, several stocks were identified as top gainers on the Nifty 50. Eternal (Zomato) stock was trading at Rs 330.30, up 1.82%, while Adani Ports was at Rs 1,411.30, a 1.6% rise. Shriram Finance was trading at Rs 612.80, gaining 1.32%, NTPC at Rs 329.10, up 1.06%, and ONGC at Rs 233.85, with a 0.91% increase. Financial Snapshot of Eternal Eternal's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 7,167 Crore, compared to Rs 4,206 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 25 Crore, a decrease from Rs 253 Crore in the previous year. The company's EPS was Rs 0.03, down from Rs 0.29 in June 2024. The company’s annual consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 20,243 Crore, significantly higher than Rs 12,114 Crore in March 2024. The net profit was Rs 527 Crore, compared to Rs 351 Crore in the previous year. The EPS increased to Rs 0.60 from Rs 0.41, and the company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00. The net profit was Rs 3,153.30 Crore, compared to Rs 3,184.39 Crore in the previous year. The EPS was Rs 15.34, slightly higher than Rs 14.41 in June 2024. The company’s annual consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 31,078.60 Crore, an increase from Rs 26,710.56 Crore in March 2024. title: Infosys shares fall nearly 1% in morning trade; over 18.7 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Infosys were trading lower in Thursday's session, with the stock priced at Rs 1,518, a decline of 0.95% from the previous close. Over 18.7 lakh shares changed hands in the morning trade on the NSE, as of about 10.30 am. The Board of Directors will consider a proposal for buyback of equity shares of the Company at its meeting to be held on September 11, 2025. Also, Bank CTBC Indonesia Adopts Infosys Finacle Digital Banking Solution On Cloud. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 22 per share (440%) on April 17, 2025, with an effective date of May 30, 2025. The company had also announced an interim dividend of Rs 21 per share (420%) on October 17, 2024, with an effective date of October 29, 2024. Infosys has a history of bonus issues, including a 1:1 bonus on July 13, 2018 and June 15, 2015. Infosys last split its shares on January 24, 2000, with an old face value of Rs 10 and a new face value of Rs 5. Infosys is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. As of September 4, 2025, Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bearish sentiment on the stock. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 1,518, Infosys has seen a decline of 0.95% from the previous close.

title: NLC India, Cochin Shipyard stocks among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150 in today's trading
content: The Indian stock market witnessed several stocks posting gains in Thursday's trading session. At 10:30 am, NLC India was among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150, trading at Rs 257.68, a 3.64% increase. Other notable gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 included Cochin Shipyard at Rs 1,696.50, up 3.24%, GE Vernova TD at Rs 2,835.70, up 2.53%, Hitachi Energy at Rs 20,140.00, up 2.36%, and Hind Zinc at Rs 441.90, up 2.09%. NLC India Financial Overview NLC India's financial performance reveals the following: Consolidated Financials: Quarterly Results: For the quarter-ending June 2025, NLC India reported a revenue of Rs 3,825.61 Crore and a net profit of Rs 839.15 Crore, resulting in an EPS of Rs 5.02. Annual Results: The company’s annual revenue for March 2025 stood at Rs 15,282.96 Crore, with a net profit of Rs 2,713.37 Crore and an EPS of Rs 19.57. Corporate Actions NLC India NLC India announced a final dividend of Rs 1.50 per share (15%) with effective date of 19 Sep, 2025. The company is holding its 69th Annual General Meeting on Saturday, 27th September, 2025 at 15:00 Hours (IST) through Video Conferencing (VC)/Other Audio Visual Means (OAVM). Cochin Shipyard Cochin Shipyard announced a final dividend of Rs 2.25 per share (45%) with effective date of 12 Sep, 2025. The company had a split where old face value was Rs 10 and new face value is Rs 5, with exsplit date of 10 Jan, 2024. GE Vernova TD GE Vernova TD announced a final dividend of Rs 5.00 per share (250%) with effective date of 22 Aug, 2025. The company had a bonus issue on 01 Dec, 1990, 01 Dec, 1988 and 01 Dec, 1980 with bonus ratio of 1:1. The company had a split where old face value was Rs 10 and new face value is Rs 2, with exsplit date of 22 Oct, 2008. Hitachi Energy Hitachi Energy announced a final dividend of Rs 6.00 per share (300%) with effective date of 13 Aug, 2025. Hind Zinc Hind Zinc announced a first interim dividend of Rs 10.00 per share (500%) with effective date of 17 Jun, 2025. The company had a bonus issue on 19 Jan, 2011 with bonus ratio of 1:1 and split where old face value was Rs 10 and new face value is Rs 2, with exsplit date of 07 Mar, 2011. NLC India, Cochin Shipyard, GE Vernova TD, Hitachi Energy and Hind Zinc were among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 at 10:30 am on Thursday.

The company announced a final dividend of Rs 1.00 per share (10%) on May 13, 2025, with an effective date of August 4, 2025. The company had last issued bonus shares on July 27, 2022, in the ratio of 1:2, with an ex-bonus date of September 6, 2022. Moneycontrol analysis indicated a bearish sentiment on the stock as of September 4, 2025.

title: Bharat Heavy Electricals shares rise 2.17%; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Bharat Heavy Electricals shares were trading at Rs 224.80, up 2.17% in Thursday's session. At 10:28 am, the stock was among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Snapshot: Bharat Heavy Electricals' financial performance shows the following trends based on consolidated figures:Revenue: The company's annual revenue has increased from Rs 17,308.69 Crore in 2021 to Rs 28,339.48 Crore in 2025.Net Profit: The company's net profit has seen a turnaround from a loss of Rs 2,743.84 Crore in 2021 to a profit of Rs 474.89 Crore in 2025.EPS: The company's earnings per share (EPS) has improved from -Rs 7.75 in 2021 to Rs 1.53 in 2025.Here is a detailed financial overview:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to Equity202117,308.69-2,743.84-7.7574.59-10.380.19202221,211.09394.291.2876.121.680.18202323,364.94421.371.3777.051.770.20202423,892.78218.240.8170.181.150.36202528,339.48474.891.5371.002.150.36The company’s revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 28,339.48 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 23,892.78 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. Net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 474.89 Crore, compared to Rs 218.24 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The company's EPS also increased from Rs 0.81 in 2024 to Rs 1.53 in 2025. Quarterly Performance:QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 20245,484.92-225.61-0.61Sep 20246,584.1089.530.30Dec 20247,277.09116.440.39Mar 20258,993.37494.531.45Jun 20255,486.91-469.17-1.31The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 5,486.91 Crore, while the net loss stood at Rs 469.17 Crore and EPS at -Rs 1.31. In comparison, for the quarter-ending June 2024, the revenue was Rs 5,484.92 Crore, with a net loss of Rs 225.61 Crore and EPS of -Rs 0.61. Corporate Actions:Memorandum of Understanding: BHEL signed an MOU with Horizon Fuel Cell Technologies Pte Ltd on September 5, 2025.Order Receipt: BHEL received a Letter of Intent (LOI) from MB Power (Madhya Pradesh) Limited on September 3, 2025.Dissolution of Joint Venture: A revised declaration regarding the dissolution of a Joint Venture Company was announced on September 2, 2025.Dividends: The company has announced the following dividends:May 16, 2025: Final dividend of Rs 0.50 per share (25%), effective August 1, 2025.May 21, 2024: Final dividend of Rs 0.25 per share (12.5%), effective August 9, 2024.Bonus History: The company has issued bonus shares on two occasions:August 10, 2017: Bonus ratio of 1:2, ex-bonus date was September 28, 2017.January 25, 2007: Bonus ratio of 1:1, ex-bonus date was May 31, 2007.Stock Splits:The company split its stock on October 3, 2011, with the old face value of Rs 10 being split into a new face value of Rs 2.Bharat Heavy Electricals is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Moneycontrol analysis as of September 8, 2025, suggests a bearish sentiment on the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 224.80, Bharat Heavy Electricals has shown a positive movement in today's session.

title: Eternal-Zomato shares rise 2.08% in morning trade
content: Eternal (Zomato) shares were trading at Rs 331.15, up 2.08% in Thursday's session, at 10:25 am. The stock is part of the Nifty 50 index. Financial Highlights: Eternal's financial performance shows the following trends based on consolidated results:Revenue: The company's annual revenue has increased consistently over the past five years. For the year-ending March 2025, the revenue stood at Rs 20,243 Crore, compared to Rs 12,114 Crore in March 2024, marking a 67.19% increase.Net Profit: The company has turned profitable in recent years. For the year-ending March 2025, the net profit was Rs 527 Crore, compared to Rs 351 Crore in March 2024.EPS: Earnings per share have also turned positive. The EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 0.60, compared to Rs 0.41 in March 2024.The following table summarizes the key financial figures:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Mar 20211,993.79-816.43-1.51Mar 20224,192.40-1,222.80-1.67Mar 20237,079.40-970.70-1.20Mar 202412,114.00351.000.41Mar 202520,243.00527.000.60Quarterly Performance: The quarterly revenue and net profit are as follows:QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPSJun 20244,206.00253.000.29Sep 20244,799.00176.000.20Dec 20245,405.0059.000.07Mar 20255,833.0039.000.04Jun 20257,167.0025.000.03Financial Ratios: Key financial ratios for Eternal show a basic EPS of Rs 0.60 and a diluted EPS of Rs 0.58 as of March 2025. Eternal Limited submitted the exchange a copy of scrutinizers report and voting results of 15th Annual General Meeting held on August 19, 2025. According to Moneycontrol analysis, the sentiment for Eternal is very bullish as of September 11, 2025. title: Hindustan Zinc shares rise 2.08% in morning trade
content: Hindustan Zinc shares were trading at Rs 441.85, up 2.08% from the previous close, at 10:24 am. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Performance: The consolidated quarterly financial performance shows the following trends:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 8,130.00 CroreRs 8,252.00 CroreRs 8,614.00 CroreRs 9,087.00 CroreRs 7,771.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,345.00 CroreRs 2,327.00 CroreRs 2,678.00 CroreRs 3,003.00 CroreRs 2,234.00 CroreEPS5.555.516.347.115.29The revenue for Hindustan Zinc has fluctuated over the last five quarters, with a high of Rs 9,087.00 Crore in March 2025 and a recent value of Rs 7,771.00 Crore in June 2025. Similarly, the net profit peaked at Rs 3,003.00 Crore in March 2025 but decreased to Rs 2,234.00 Crore in June 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) followed a similar trend, reaching Rs 7.11 in March 2025 before falling to Rs 5.29 in June 2025. The consolidated yearly financial performance is as follows:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 22,629.00 CroreRs 29,440.00 CroreRs 34,098.00 CroreRs 28,932.00 CroreRs 34,083.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 7,980.00 CroreRs 9,629.00 CroreRs 10,511.00 CroreRs 7,759.00 CroreRs 10,353.00 CroreEPS18.8922.7924.8818.3624.50BVPS76.4881.1430.6135.9631.54ROE24.6928.0881.2751.0677.69Debt to Equity0.220.080.920.560.80The annual revenue for Hindustan Zinc has increased from Rs 22,629.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 34,083.00 Crore in 2025. Net profit has also shown growth, from Rs 7,980.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 10,353.00 Crore in 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) have risen from Rs 18.89 in 2021 to Rs 24.50 in 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio has fluctuated, reaching 0.80 in 2025. Corporate Actions: Hindustan Zinc has announced several corporate actions, including announcements under Regulation 30 (LODR) related to credit ratings and newspaper publications. The company announced a dividend of Rs 10.00 per share (500%) as a First Interim Dividend with an effective date of June 17, 2025. Other dividends were announced in 2024 and 2023. A bonus issue with a ratio of 1:1 was announced on January 19, 2011, and a stock split was announced on the same date. A Moneycontrol analysis, as of September 5, 2025, indicates a very bullish sentiment on the stock.

title: Infosys among top losers on Nifty 50; share price falls 0.94%
content: Infosys shares were trading lower, with the stock among the top losers on the Nifty 50 at 10:10 am on Thursday. The stock declined by 0.94% to Rs 1,518.20. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 162,990 Crore, marking an increase from Rs 153,670 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the same period was Rs 26,750 Crore, compared to Rs 26,248 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The company’s earnings per share (EPS) also saw an uptick, with the basic EPS at Rs 64.50 for the year-ending March 2025, up from Rs 63.39 in the year-ending March 2024. Key financial ratios for Infosys show a P/E ratio of 24.35 and a P/B ratio of 6.80 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025. title: Endurance Technologies share price falls 2.14%, stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Endurance Technologies declined by 2.14% to Rs 2,976.20 in Thursday's trading session. The fall places the stock among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. At 10:10 am, the stock was trading lower compared to its previous close. On August 26, 2025, Endurance Technologies Limited released newspaper advertisements in the Financial Express (English) and the Loksatta (Marathi) regarding the Investor Education and Protection Fund Authority’s “Saksham Niveshak” campaign. Endurance Technologies is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Midcap 150 index. title: ITC share among top gainers on Nifty 50, rises 0.42%
content: Shares of ITC were trading higher on Thursday, with the stock among the top gainers on the Nifty 50. At 10:10 am, ITC was trading at Rs 414.80 on the NSE, a 0.42% rise from the previous close. Financial Performance: Consolidated Quarterly Performance: ITC's consolidated quarterly revenue has shown a fluctuating trend. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 21,494.79 Crore, up from Rs 18,765.00 Crore in March 2025. The net profit for the June 2025 quarter was Rs 5,274.65 Crore, compared to Rs 19,709.47 Crore in the previous quarter. The EPS for June 2025 was Rs 4.19, while it was Rs 15.77 for March 2025. Here is a summary of ITC's consolidated quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 18,457.33 CroreRs 19,990.36 CroreRs 18,790.17 CroreRs 18,765.00 CroreRs 21,494.79 CroreNet ProfitRs 5,169.37 CroreRs 5,050.28 CroreRs 5,009.08 CroreRs 19,709.47 CroreRs 5,274.65 CroreEPS4.083.993.9515.774.19Consolidated Yearly Performance: ITC's consolidated yearly revenue has shown a growth trend from 2021 to 2025. The revenue for the year 2025 stood at Rs 75,323.34 Crore, up from Rs 70,881.00 Crore in 2024. However, the net profit for 2025 was Rs 19,926.05 Crore, slightly down from Rs 20,723.75 Crore in the previous year. The EPS for 2025 was Rs 27.79, significantly higher than Rs 16.42 in 2024. Here is a summary of ITC's consolidated yearly financial performance:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 49,272.78 CroreRs 60,668.09 CroreRs 70,936.85 CroreRs 70,881.00 CroreRs 75,323.34 CroreNet ProfitRs 13,389.80 CroreRs 15,485.65 CroreRs 19,427.68 CroreRs 20,723.75 CroreRs 19,926.05 CroreEPS10.7012.3715.5016.4227.79BVPS49.3150.9855.9559.9955.96ROE21.8024.4027.7527.4549.61Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00ITC's annual sales for March 2025 stood at Rs 75,323 Crore, compared to Rs 70,881 Crore in March 2024. The other income was Rs 2,529 Crore in March 2025, versus Rs 2,727 Crore in March 2024. The total expenditure for the same period was Rs 50,991 Crore, down from Rs 46,450 Crore. The EBIT was Rs 26,861 Crore, and the net profit was Rs 19,926 Crore. Corporate Actions: ITC has announced and executed several corporate actions, including dividends. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 7.85 per share (785%) on May 22, 2025, with an effective date of May 28, 2025. Earlier, an interim dividend of Rs 6.50 per share (650%) was announced on February 6, 2025, and was effective from February 12, 2025. The company had also allotted shares under its Employee Stock Option Schemes. Financial Ratios: ITC's financial ratios provide insights into its performance and efficiency. The basic EPS for March 2025 was Rs 27.79, up from Rs 16.42 in March 2024. The book value per share (excluding revaluation reserve) was Rs 55.96 in March 2025, compared to Rs 59.99 in March 2024. The return on net worth/equity was 49.61% in March 2025, significantly higher than 27.45% in March 2024. The debt-to-equity ratio remained at 0.00. The dividend per share was Rs 14.35 and the face value was Rs 1 in March 2025. Moneycontrol analysis made on 2025-09-04 indicates a bullish sentiment on the stock. ITC is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. With the stock currently trading at Rs 414.80, ITC is among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 this hour.

title: Nomura sees 30 percent upside for Gail India on one-time boost from tariff hike and petchem recovery
content: Shares of Gail India are higher by over 2.5 percent to be the top F&O gainer in the trading session on September 11, after brokerage Nomura issued a Buy call with a target of Rs 225 per share, which is nearly 30 percent higher than the last closing price, projecting that the company will get a one-time benefit from the proposed tariff hikes. Nomura said a tariff hike could provide a one-time boost to Gail India, with an integrated tariff increase of over 20 percent could potentially surprise investors on the upside. The note also said that Gail's petchem segment is expected to start seeing a recovery from FY27e onwards, contributing to the high investor interest in the stock. Gail India has already seen volumes of 55 lakh shares, at more than half of its one-month and one-week average. On a YTD basis, shares of Gail India are lower by 6.7 percent, and over the last one year, the shares are down 18 percent. However, over the last three years, Gail India shares are higher by 93 percent. The month of September has traditionally been positive for the stock, with the company delivering positive returns in 13 out of last 17 years during the month. The company has submitted a request to Petroleum and Natural Gas Regulatory Board (PNGRB) for a 33 percent increase in gas tariff to Rs 78/mmbtu, citing rising cost of substitute gas used by compressors in pipeline operations, since gas allocation under Administered Price Mechanism (APM) has been cut to zero. Also, the capacity determination by PNGRB for GAIL’s integrated pipeline has come out to be lower than previously expected. Gail's revenue from operations from natural gas transmission in FY25 rose by 7 percent on year to Rs 11,068 crore due to increase in transmission volume and upward revision in tariffs. The company has a near 65 percent share in India's natural gas transmission. Nomura said it expects tariffs to be revised to around Rs 70/mmbtu with effect from April 2026, which is an increase of 19.5 percent. According to the note, this should translate into a 42 percent on year rise in gas transmission EBIT during FY27e, and the consolidated group EBIT is expected to rise by 24 percent. Gail is India's largest state-run natural gas processing and distribution company, with interests in domestic and overseas oil and gas assets, renewable energy and City Gas Distribution as well as Compressed Biogas. The regulator is in the process of finalising the integrated tariff of Gail India, which is an integral part of the 'Unified Tariff'. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Shares of Gail India are higher by over 2.5 percent to be the top F&O gainer in the trading session on September 11, after brokerage Nomura issued a Buy call with a target of Rs 225 per share, which is nearly 30 percent higher than the last closing price, projecting that the company will get a one-time benefit from the proposed tariff hikes.

title: IT stocks see profit booking after 5.5% rise in two days as investors await US CPI data; Infosys, Wipro lead losses
content: IT shares came under selling pressure on Thursday after a sharp two-day rise, with investors booking profits ahead of key US inflation data. After gaining up to 5.5 percent in the past two sessions on hopes of a US Federal Reserve rate cut, the Nifty IT index slipped nearly 1 percent, making it one of the top sectoral losers. Nine out of 10 constituents traded in the red. Persistent Systems led the fall, declining up to 2 percent to Rs 5,326 apiece on the NSE. Infosys dropped 1.38 percent as investors tracked for updates from the board of IT major which convenes today to consider a proposal for share buyback, which will be the first one in three years, and fifth in last eight years. Decision on Infosys buyback closely watched as board considers first proposal in three years LTIMindtree shed 1.66 percent. Wipro, HCL Technologies, Tech Mahindra and Mphasis also traded lower, slipping up to 1.3 percent. Tata Consultancy Services was the sole gainer, edging up 0.14 percent. The recent rally in IT shares was fuelled by expectations of a Fed rate cut and easing trade concerns after US President Donald Trump said Washington and New Delhi would resume talks to resolve trade differences. Indian IT firms derive a significant share of their revenue from the US market. However, sentiment turned cautious as investors awaited US consumer price index (CPI) data, due later in the day, following weaker-than-expected producer price numbers. A Reuters poll projected CPI to rise 0.3 percent month-on-month in August, after a 0.2 percent increase in July. On a year-on-year basis, CPI was seen at 2.9 percent versus 2.7 percent in July. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Sona BLW Precision Forgings shares fall 2.03%, stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Sona BLW Precision Forgings declined by 2.03% to Rs 440.90 in morning trade. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index at 10:04 am. On the financial front, Sona BLW Precision Forgings has demonstrated consistent growth in both quarterly and annual results. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 850.90 Crore, compared to Rs 864.75 Crore in March 2025. The net profit for the same period was Rs 121.71 Crore, while the EPS was Rs 2.01. title: Ola Electric, Sona BLW stocks among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150 today
content: Several stocks underperformed in Indian markets on Thursday. Ola Electric shares were among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. At 10:00 am, Ola Electric was trading at Rs 58.11, a 2.11% fall from its previous close. Other top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 included Sona BLW (down 1.86% to Rs 441.70), Persistent (down 1.48% to Rs 5,339.00), MphasiS (down 1.39% to Rs 2,927.20) and Endurance Techn (down 1.38% to Rs 2,999.20).Ola Electric Financial OverviewHere's a look at the key financial data for Ola Electric:Quarterly Results (Consolidated)HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,644.00 CroreRs 1,214.00 CroreRs 1,045.00 CroreRs 611.00 CroreRs 828.00 CroreNet Profit-Rs 347.00 Crore-Rs 495.00 Crore-Rs 564.00 Crore-Rs 870.00 Crore-Rs 428.00 CroreEPS-0.95-1.20-1.28-1.97-0.97The quarterly results show a fluctuating revenue stream. title: NLC India shares jump 1.88% amid high volume in early trade

title: Cochin Shipyard shares rise 2.24% in early trade
content: Shares of Cochin Shipyard were trading higher at Rs 1,680.00, up 2.24% in Thursday's session. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Performance: Quarterly Performance: Cochin Shipyard's revenue and net profit have shown variability over the last few quarters. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 1,068.59 Crore, compared to Rs 1,757.65 Crore in March 2025. The net profit for the same period was Rs 187.83 Crore, slightly up from Rs 174.24 Crore in June 2024. The following table presents the consolidated quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 771.47 CroreRs 1,143.20 CroreRs 1,147.64 CroreRs 1,757.65 CroreRs 1,068.59 CroreNet ProfitRs 174.24 CroreRs 188.92 CroreRs 176.99 CroreRs 287.19 CroreRs 187.83 CroreEPS6.627.186.7310.927.14Annual Performance: The company has demonstrated substantial growth in annual revenue and net profit. For the year-ending March 2025, the consolidated revenue was Rs 4,819.96 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 3,830.45 Crore in the previous year. Net profit also increased from Rs 783.28 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 827.33 Crore in March 2025. The following table summarizes the consolidated yearly financial performance:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 2,818.90 CroreRs 3,190.95 CroreRs 2,364.55 CroreRs 3,830.45 CroreRs 4,819.96 CroreNet ProfitRs 608.66 CroreRs 563.96 CroreRs 304.71 CroreRs 783.28 CroreRs 827.33 CroreEPS46.2742.8723.1629.7731.45BVPS306.63333.98336.60190.18212.07ROE15.0912.836.8815.6514.82Debt to Equity0.030.030.030.000.01The consolidated income statement for the year ending March 2025 shows sales of Rs 4,819 Crore and other income of Rs 389 Crore, resulting in a total income of Rs 5,209 Crore. Total expenditure amounted to Rs 4,045 Crore, leading to an EBIT of Rs 1,163 Crore. After accounting for interest (Rs 38 Crore) and tax (Rs 297 Crore), the net profit stood at Rs 827 Crore. Corporate Actions: Cochin Shipyard announced a final dividend of Rs 2.25 per share on May 15, 2025, with the record date for payment being September 2, 2025. Additionally, a stock split from a face value of Rs 10 to Rs 5 was executed on January 10, 2024. With the stock currently trading at Rs 1,680.00, Cochin Shipyard showcases a positive move in today's session.

title: Patanjali Foods shares adjust to 2:1 bonus issue: Here's why you should ignore the 67% plunge
content: The shares of Patanjali Foods appeared to have fallen nearly 67 percent in one single session on September 11, as the stock price adjusted to a bonus issue of shares. The stock was actually trading in the red with marginal losses at Rs 596 apiece. Patanjali Foods' board of directors during a meeting in July had approved the issue of bonus shares in the ratio of 2:1. The record date to determine the eligibility of the shareholders set to receive the bonus equity shares was set on September 11. A company announces bonus issue of shares to reward its existing shareholders with an investment opportunity, which is perceived to be attractive. While the issue of bonus shares increases the total number of shares issued and owned, it does not change the market capitalization of the company. This increases the overall liquidity of the stock, and makes it more affordable for other investors to add to their portfolio, creating strong upside potential for the stock. As a result, Patanjali Foods shares appeared to have crashed 67 percent in one session, while in reality, they simply adjusted to the bonus issue. After the issuance of bonus shares, the company's market capitalization stands at around Rs 64,856 crore and the stock's P/E ratio nears 18. The issuance of bonus shares will likely increase investors' confidence for the stock, as it reflects on the firm's strong financials and growth potential. Bonus issue essentially are free shares offered by a company from its reserves. Investors must own shares of the company as on the record date to be eligible for the bonus issue. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Investors must own shares of the company as on the record date to be eligible for the bonus issue.

title: Gujarat Fluorochemicals shares fall 3.17% in morning trade
content: Shares of Gujarat Fluorochemicals Limited declined by 3.17% to Rs 3,627.10 in Thursday's trading session. At 10:04 am, the stock experienced a notable dip, trading lower than its previous close. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Performance: Gujarat Fluorochemicals' financial performance shows a fluctuating but generally positive trend. Here's an overview of the company's consolidated financial data: Quarterly Results: The company has demonstrated consistent revenue generation over the last five quarters. The revenue increased from Rs 1,176.00 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 1,281.00 Crore in June 2025. title: Decision on Infosys buyback closely watched as board considers first proposal in three years
content: Investors will closely track for updates as the board of IT major Infosys convenes today to consider a proposal for share buyback, which will be the first one in three years, and fifth in last eight years. Shares of the company opened quiet on September 11 but slipped nearly a percent lower to be the top loser on Nifty 50. The shares have gained 2.6 percent in last one week and 6.6 percent over last one month, while on a YTD basis, shares of Infosys are lower by 19 percent. Market participants will be closely watching for the size of the buyback and how much of its cash reserves will the company deploy to purchases shares from investors. Also on radar will be the premium that the company will offer in order to buy back the shares. The timing of the buyback is also interesting, coming at a time for ongoing tariffs by US President Trump on Indian exports, and when the US economy has been facing risks of a slowdown, and amid calls of curb on US H1-B visas among Trump's supporters. In a recent note, Morgan Stanley has said that it sees a buyback of around Rs 10,000-14,000 crore by Infosys, coming in at around 18-25 percent premium to the current price. As of June 2025, Infosys was sitting on cash on books worth Rs 24,500 crore. Infosys has a high cash-generating business with access to global capital. The company's primary source of funds is cash from operations and income from short and long-term investments, among others. "Our strong performance on the back of meticulous execution over the years, as reflected in the combination of high growth, strong cash generation and profitability, has led to building a strong, debt-free, and liquid Balance Sheet," the company had said in its annual report for FY25. The company has returned nearly Rs 88,400 crore, or 85% of the cumulative free cash flow between FY20-24 through dividends and buybacks, as part of its capital allocation policy. During the year ended March 31, 2025, Infosys paid an interim dividend of Rs 21 per share and announced a final dividend of Rs 22 per share. In the last five years preceding FY25, Infosys had purchased and extinguished a total of 11.62 crore fully paid-up equity shares from stock exchanges. The company has only one class of equity shares and even ADR holders are eligible for the buyback. Motilal Oswal has a Neutral call on Infosys with a target price of Rs 1750, and Prabhudas Lilladher has an Accumulate call with the same target. The IT space has not seen a buyback from the top-tier names in the last two years, and both Wipro and TCS are eligible to come out with their own, thus Infosys' board decision a closely watched by market participants. Both TCS and Wipro have conducted five buybacks each between 2016-2023, whereas Infosys has carried out four buybacks since 2017. The IT services major had revised its full-year revenue growth guidance for FY26 to 1-3 percent growth in constant currency (CC), increasing the lower end of the range. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: The shares have gained 2.6 percent in last one week and 6.6 percent over last one month, while on a YTD basis, shares of Infosys are lower by 19 percent.
summary_luhn: The IT space has not seen a buyback from the top-tier names in the last two years, and both Wipro and TCS are eligible to come out with their own, thus Infosys' board decision a closely watched by market participants.
summary_lsa: In the last five years preceding FY25, Infosys had purchased and extinguished a total of 11.62 crore fully paid-up equity shares from stock exchanges.
summary_textrank: "Our strong performance on the back of meticulous execution over the years, as reflected in the combination of high growth, strong cash generation and profitability, has led to building a strong, debt-free, and liquid Balance Sheet," the company had said in its annual report for FY25.

title: Positive index contributors on Nifty 50 include Reliance, Bajaj Finance, and SBI
content: At 9:25 am on Thursday, the Nifty 50 index showcased several stocks contributing positively to its performance. Key contributors included Reliance, Bajaj Finance, and SBI, among others. Key Positive Index Contributors:Reliance: 1381.70 (8.63)Bajaj Finance: 971.60 (5.61)SBI: 823.55 (5.48)TCS: 3124.80 (3.96)Titan Company: 3635.00 (3.16)Larsen: 3558.50 (2.66)Jio Financial: 311.70 (2.59)NTPC: 329.65 (2.39)Bajaj Finserv: 2042.90 (1.85)Tata Motors: 710.80 (1.54)ONGC: 233.68 (1.51)Tata Steel: 169.70 (0.58)Cipla: 1568.00 (0.54)Axis Bank: 1071.10 (0.54)Asian Paints: 2547.20 (0.46)Maruti Suzuki: 15119.00 (0.38)Several companies have announced corporate actions. Reliance announced the incorporation of a wholly-owned subsidiary, Reliance Intelligence Limited, on September 10, 2025. Additionally, there were updates on institutional investors' meetings where company executives participated in forums such as the CITIC CLSA Investors' Forum 2025 and the Goldman Sachs Asia Leaders Conference. These meetings did not involve the sharing of any unpublished price-sensitive information. Bajaj Finance faces scrutiny regarding recent volume movements, with the Exchange seeking clarification on September 5, 2025. The company also reported the allotment of equity shares under its Employee Stock Option Scheme 2009. SBI executives participated in investor interactions arranged by Bank of America in Hong Kong and CLSA at Hong Kong. TCS announced partnerships and projects, including a collaboration with CEA to advance Physical AI Research and Innovation in France, and selection by the Government of Odisha to build a next-generation, AI-enabled Integrated Financial Management System. Larsen & Toubro (L&T) highlighted its L&T Energy GreenTech's partnership with Japan's ITOCHU for a Green Ammonia Project. Jio Financial Services Limited announced the incorporation of a joint venture company named Allianz Jio Reinsurance Limited on September 8, 2025, in collaboration with Allianz Europe B.V. The company will engage in the reinsurance business in India, subject to regulatory approvals. NTPC disclosed the appointment of Statutory Auditors for the financial year 2025-26, aligning with the appointments for the financial years 2023-24 and 2024-25. The company also reported the discontinuation of operations at the Tanda Thermal Power Station, Stage-I (4X110 MW). Tata Steel provided updates on its unlisted insurance subsidiaries. Tata Motors is also actively engaging with analysts and investors, participating in meetings and discussions. The consolidated financial performance of Reliance showcases robust revenue and net profit figures. Quarterly revenue has seen an increase from Rs 231,784 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 243,632 Crore in June 2025. Net profit also significantly increased from Rs 17,448 Crore to Rs 30,681 Crore over the same period. In summary, several stocks, including Reliance, Bajaj Finance, and SBI, have shown positive contributions to the Nifty 50 index, reflecting varied financial performances and strategic corporate actions.

title: Larsen & Toubro shares rise marginally in early trade
content: Shares of Larsen & Toubro were trading at Rs 3,555.90, up 0.17% from the previous close, at 9:20 am on the NSE. The company's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth. The annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 255,734.45 Crore, a notable increase compared to Rs 221,112.91 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the same period was Rs 17,687.39 Crore, up from Rs 15,569.72 Crore in March 2024. The company's earnings per share (EPS) also increased from Rs 93.96 to Rs 109.36. Here is a summary of Larsen & Toubro's key financial data:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)2021135,979.034,668.9682.492022156,521.2310,291.0561.712023183,340.7012,624.8774.512024221,112.9115,569.7293.962025255,734.4517,687.39109.36The company’s quarterly revenue also reflects positive momentum. For the quarter-ending June 2025, the revenue was Rs 63,678.92 Crore, compared to Rs 55,119.82 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 4,325.57 Crore, up from Rs 3,440.11 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS also increased from Rs 20.26 to Rs 26.30.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 202455,119.823,440.1120.26Sep 202461,554.584,112.8124.69Dec 202464,667.784,001.0324.43Mar 202574,392.286,133.4439.98Jun 202563,678.924,325.5726.30Larsen & Toubro has consistently rewarded its shareholders through dividends. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 34 per share on May 8, 2025, which was effective from June 3, 2025. Previously, a final dividend of Rs 28 per share was announced on May 8, 2024, effective from June 20, 2024. The company has also issued bonus shares in the past, with the last bonus issue announced on May 29, 2017, in the ratio of 1:2. Larsen & Toubro is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. With the stock currently trading at Rs 3,555.90, Larsen & Toubro has shown a marginal increase from its previous close.

title: Ola Electric Mobility share price falls 2.29% in early trade
content: Ola Electric Mobility's stock experienced a decline of 2.29% in early trading, with the price falling to Rs 58. At 9:20 am, the stock is trading lower compared to its previous close. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. title: NTPC shares gain 1.29% in early trade on Nifty 50
content: NTPC shares were trading higher at Rs 329.85, up 1.29% in Thursday's early trading session. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. Financial Performance: NTPC's consolidated financial performance reveals the following trends: Quarterly Results: For the quarter-ending June 2025, NTPC reported a revenue of Rs 47,065.36 Crore and a net profit of Rs 5,631.89 Crore. In comparison, the previous quarters show:March 2025: Revenue of Rs 49,833.70 Crore, Net Profit of Rs 7,264.63 CroreDecember 2024: Revenue of Rs 45,052.82 Crore, Net Profit of Rs 4,712.20 CroreSeptember 2024: Revenue of Rs 44,696.30 Crore, Net Profit of Rs 4,990.50 CroreJune 2024: Revenue of Rs 48,520.57 Crore, Net Profit of Rs 4,772.11 CroreAnnual Results: For the year-ending March 2025, NTPC's financials include:Revenue: Rs 188,138.06 CroreNet Profit: Rs 21,739.44 CroreEPS: Rs 20.34BVPS: Rs 189.83ROE: 12.72%Debt to Equity: 1.34A comparison with previous years shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit:2024: Revenue of Rs 178,500.88 Crore, Net Profit of Rs 19,696.85 Crore2023: Revenue of Rs 176,206.93 Crore, Net Profit of Rs 16,341.58 Crore2022: Revenue of Rs 132,669.28 Crore, Net Profit of Rs 15,940.16 Crore2021: Revenue of Rs 111,531.15 Crore, Net Profit of Rs 14,285.53 CroreFinancial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to EquityMar 2021111,531.1514,285.5314.87133.3111.631.57Mar 2022132,669.2815,940.1617.20143.4912.311.55Mar 2023176,206.9316,341.5817.44155.6811.501.50Mar 2024178,500.8819,696.8521.46165.7412.951.46Mar 2025188,138.0621,739.4420.34189.8312.721.34The company’s revenue increased by 5.39% in 2025 compared to 2024, and the net profit increased by 10.37% over the same period.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)Jun 202448,520.574,772.11Sep 202444,696.304,990.50Dec 202445,052.824,712.20Mar 202549,833.707,264.63Jun 202547,065.365,631.89Corporate Actions: Recent corporate actions include:Appointment of Statutory Auditors for the financial year 2025-26.Discontinuation of operations of Tanda Thermal Power Station, Stage-I (4X110 MW).Outcome of the 49th AGM.The company announced a final dividend of Rs 3.35 per share (33.5%) on May 26, 2025, with an effective date of September 4, 2025. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs 2.50 per share (25%) was announced on January 27, 2025, effective January 31, 2025. NTPC had also announced a bonus issue on January 30, 2019, with a bonus ratio of 1:5, and the ex-bonus date was March 19, 2019. With the stock currently trading at Rs 329.85, NTPC shows positive movement in today's early trading session.

title: Waaree Energies shares rise 2.33% in early trade
content: Shares of Waaree Energies were trading higher in Thursday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 3,558.70, a gain of 2.33% from the previous close, at 09:25 am. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Performance: Waaree Energies has shown robust financial performance in recent years. Here's a look at the company's consolidated quarterly and yearly results: Consolidated Quarterly Results (in Rs Crore):Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025Revenue3,408.903,574.383,457.294,003.934,425.83Net Profit401.13375.66506.88644.47772.89EPS14.9813.7518.4121.5925.94The company's revenue has increased consistently over the quarters, with a notable jump from Rs 3,408.90 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 4,425.83 Crore in June 2025. Similarly, the net profit has risen from Rs 401.13 Crore to Rs 772.89 Crore during the same period. Earnings per share (EPS) have also shown a corresponding increase. Consolidated Yearly Results (in Rs Crore):2022202320242025Revenue2,854.276,750.8711,397.6114,444.50Net Profit79.65500.281,274.381,928.13EPS3.8421.8248.0568.24BVPS21.6975.54155.45329.96ROE17.6826.2530.2619.69Debt to Equity0.730.150.080.10The annual revenue has seen a substantial increase from Rs 2,854.27 Crore in 2022 to Rs 14,444.50 Crore in 2025. The net profit has also grown significantly from Rs 79.65 Crore to Rs 1,928.13 Crore over the same period. The company's EPS, BVPS and ROE have also shown positive trends, reflecting improved financial health and profitability. The Debt to Equity ratio has decreased from 0.73 in 2022 to 0.10 in 2025. title: Tata Consultancy Services shares rise 0.58% in early trade
content: Tata Consultancy Services shares were trading at Rs 3,128, up 0.58% from the previous close, at 9:20 am on Thursday. Financial Performance: Tata Consultancy Services' consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit. The company's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 255,324 Crore, compared to Rs 240,893 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. Net profit for the same period increased to Rs 48,797 Crore from Rs 46,099 Crore. The following table presents key financial figures for Tata Consultancy Services (Consolidated):HeadingMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 255,324 CroreRs 240,893 CroreRs 225,458 CroreRs 191,754 CroreRs 164,177 CroreOther IncomeRs 3,962 CroreRs 4,422 CroreRs 3,449 CroreRs 4,018 CroreRs 3,134 CroreTotal IncomeRs 259,286 CroreRs 245,315 CroreRs 228,907 CroreRs 195,772 CroreRs 167,311 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 193,159 CroreRs 182,540 CroreRs 171,221 CroreRs 143,301 CroreRs 122,914 CroreEBITRs 66,127 CroreRs 62,775 CroreRs 57,686 CroreRs 52,471 CroreRs 44,397 CroreInterestRs 796 CroreRs 778 CroreRs 779 CroreRs 784 CroreRs 637 CroreTaxRs 16,534 CroreRs 15,898 CroreRs 14,604 CroreRs 13,238 CroreRs 11,198 CroreNet ProfitRs 48,797 CroreRs 46,099 CroreRs 42,303 CroreRs 38,449 CroreRs 32,562 CroreFor the quarter-ending June 2025, the company's revenue stood at Rs 63,437 Crore, while the net profit was Rs 12,819 Crore. In comparison, for the quarter-ending June 2024, the revenue was Rs 62,613 Crore and the net profit was Rs 12,105 Crore.HeadingJun 2025Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024SalesRs 63,437 CroreRs 64,479 CroreRs 63,973 CroreRs 64,259 CroreRs 62,613 CroreOther IncomeRs 1,660 CroreRs 1,028 CroreRs 1,243 CroreRs 729 CroreRs 962 CroreTotal IncomeRs 65,097 CroreRs 65,507 CroreRs 65,216 CroreRs 64,988 CroreRs 63,575 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 47,923 CroreRs 48,878 CroreRs 48,316 CroreRs 48,794 CroreRs 47,171 CroreEBITRs 17,174 CroreRs 16,629 CroreRs 16,900 CroreRs 16,194 CroreRs 16,404 CroreInterestRs 195 CroreRs 227 CroreRs 234 CroreRs 162 CroreRs 173 CroreTaxRs 4,160 CroreRs 4,109 CroreRs 4,222 CroreRs 4,077 CroreRs 4,126 CroreNet ProfitRs 12,819 CroreRs 12,293 CroreRs 12,444 CroreRs 11,955 CroreRs 12,105 CroreKey financial ratios for Tata Consultancy Services show a basic EPS of Rs 134.19 and a diluted EPS of Rs 134.19 as of March 2025. The book value per share was Rs 261.76. The company's debt to equity ratio was 0.00 as of March 2025. Corporate Actions: Tata Consultancy Services has announced multiple press releases, including one on September 10, 2025, regarding AI and digital twins redefining aerospace by 2035. The company also announced a partnership with CEA to advance physical AI research in France on September 9, 2025. Additionally, TCS was selected by the Government of Odisha to build a next-gen, AI-enabled integrated financial management system, announced on September 5, 2025. The company has announced a dividend of Rs 11 on June 27, 2025. Other dividends include a final dividend of Rs 30 announced on April 11, 2025, and a special dividend of Rs 66 announced on January 9, 2025. Tata Consultancy Services had last issued bonus shares on April 19, 2018, in the ratio of 1:1. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. title: Fortis Healthcare stock hits all-time high of Rs 976.65 on BSE, gains 1%
content: Fortis Healthcare shares reached an all-time high of Rs 976.65 on the BSE in the opening trade, rising nearly 1% from the previous close. Fortis Healthcare is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Midcap 150 index. The company's consolidated financial performance shows steady growth. Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,166.72 Crore, up from Rs 1,858.90 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 263.86 Crore, compared to Rs 173.39 Crore in the previous year. The EPS increased to Rs 3.45 in June 2025 from Rs 2.20 in June 2024. 2025).Launching the TVS NTORQ 150, a hyper sport scooter (September 4, 2025).Allotment related to the Scheme of Arrangement (September 1, 2025).Additionally, the company has a history of dividend payouts. Most recently, an interim dividend of Rs 10.00 per share (1000%) was announced on March 20, 2025, with an effective date of March 26, 2025. The company also issued bonus shares with a bonus ratio of 4:1, with record date as 2025-08-25 and exbonus date as 25 Aug, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment for the stock as of September 11, 2025. TVS Motor stock closed at Rs 3,495.30 yesterday, placing it among the top losers on the Nifty Next 50 index.

title: Adani Power stock among top losers on Nifty Next 50 on Wednesday, falls 1.43%
content: Adani Power shares ended lower in Wednesday's session. The stock was among the top losers on the Nifty Next 50 index, falling 1.43% to close at Rs 634.45 yesterday. Financial Snapshot: Adani Power's consolidated financial performance shows the following trends:Revenue: The company's annual revenue has increased steadily over the past five years. For the year-ending March 2025, the revenue stood at Rs 56,203.09 Crore, compared to Rs 50,351.25 Crore for the year-ending March 2024, representing an increase of approximately 11.62%.Net Profit: While net profit saw substantial growth in previous years, it decreased in the most recent fiscal year. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 12,749.61 Crore, a decrease from Rs 20,828.79 Crore in the year-ending March 2024.EPS: The earnings per share (EPS) also reflected this decrease, with the EPS for the year-ending March 2025 at Rs 32.32, down from Rs 51.62 in the year-ending March 2024.Here is a detailed financial overview:Financials (Consolidated)Mar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar title: Avenue Supermarts stock among top losers on Nifty Next 50 on Wednesday, falls 2.7%
content: Shares of Avenue Supermarts ended lower on Wednesday with the stock falling 2.7% to Rs 4,631.30. The stock was among the top losers on the Nifty Next 50 index in yesterday's session. On the financial front, Avenue Supermarts has demonstrated consistent growth. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 16,359.70 Crore, up from Rs 14,871.86 Crore in March 2025. The net profit for the same period was Rs 772.81 Crore, compared to Rs 550.79 Crore in the previous quarter. Here's a summary of Avenue Supermarts' key quarterly financial data:HeadingMar 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 12,726.55 CroreRs 14,444.50 CroreRs 15,972.55 CroreRs 14,871.86 CroreRs 16,359.70 CroreNet ProfitRs 563.14 CroreRs 659.44 CroreRs 723.54 CroreRs 550.79 CroreRs 772.81 CroreEPS8.6610.1411.128.4711.88The company's annual performance also shows a strong upward trend. Revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 59,358.05 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 50,788.83 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the same period was Rs 2,707.45 Crore, up from Rs 2,535.61 Crore. title: Torrent Pharma shares fall 1.42% on Wednesday; among top losers on Nifty Next 50
content: Shares of Torrent Pharma ended lower on Wednesday, with the stock among the top losers on the Nifty Next 50. As of yesterday's close, Torrent Pharma was at Rs 3,591.70 on the NSE, down 1.42% from the previous day. Torrent Pharma's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth. The company's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 11,516.09 Crore, compared to Rs 10,727.84 Crore in the previous year. Net profit for the same period increased to Rs 1,911.25 Crore from Rs 1,656.38 Crore. The company’s earnings per share (EPS) also rose to Rs 56.47 in March 2025 from Rs 48.94 in March 2024. The company’s quarterly performance also reflects positive trends. For the quarter-ending June 2025, Torrent Pharma reported a revenue of Rs 3,178 Crore and a net profit of Rs 548 Crore, compared to a revenue of Rs 2,959 Crore and a net profit of Rs 498 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025.HeadingMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021RevenueRs 11,516.09 CroreRs 10,727.84 CroreRs 9,620.15 CroreRs 8,508.04 CroreRs 8,004.57 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,911.25 CroreRs 1,656.38 CroreRs 1,245.23 CroreRs 777.18 CroreRs 1,251.88 CroreEPS56.4748.9436.7945.9373.98BVPS224.27202.57183.13351.75344.90ROE25.1724.1520.0913.0521.44Debt to Equity0.400.570.850.670.83Torrent Pharma has a history of rewarding its investors with dividends. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 6 per share on May 20, 2025, with an effective date of June 20, 2025. Additionally, an interim dividend of Rs 26 per share was announced on January 14, 2025, and paid on January 31, 2025. The company has also issued bonus shares in the past, with the most recent bonus issue occurring on July 8, 2022, in the ratio of 1:1. Moneycontrol's analysis as of September 8, 2025, indicates a bullish sentiment on the stock. As of the end of trading on Wednesday, Torrent Pharma was at Rs 3,591.70 on the NSE, down 1.42% from its previous close.

title: Infosys shares gain 1.9% on Wednesday, among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Infosys were ended higher on Wednesday, with the stock up 1.88%. The stock reached a high of Rs 1,534.90 and a low of Rs 1,509.30, eventually settling at Rs 1,532.60 in yesterday's session. Infosys is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index, and was among its top gainers. Financial Performance: Infosys's financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the past few years. The consolidated financial data indicates the following: Quarterly Results: The quarterly results reflect a steady increase in revenue. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 42,279 Crore, up from Rs 39,315 Crore in June 2024. title: Jupitar Wagons shares rise 6% on order win worth Rs 113 crore
content: Jupitar Wagons share price rose more than 6 percent in the opening trade on September 11 following the company received bogies supply order of approximately Rs 113 crore. At 09:18am, Jupiter Wagons was quoting at Rs 340.30, up Rs 21.10, or 6.61 percent, on the BSE. The company's subsidiary, Jupiter Tatravagonka Railwheel Factory has received a Letter of Acceptance (LOA) from Ministry of Railways, Railway Board. This order is for supply of total 9,000 LHB Axlesfor FIAT-IR Bogies, with an aggregate order value of approximately Rs 113 crore.

title: RVNL shares gain on emerging lowest bidder for West Central Railway project
content: Rail Vikas Nigam (RVNL) share price up marginally in the opening trade on September 10 after the company emerged as the lowest bidder for the project from West Central Railway. At 09:22am, Rail Vikas Nigam was quoting at Rs 334.65, up Rs 1.25, or 0.37 percent, on the BSE. ".... emerges as the lowest bidder (L1) for design/ modification, supply, erection, testing and commissioning of 220/132kV/2X25 kV Scott connected traction substation and switching posts with AT including SCADA work between BINA to RTA section of Bhopal division of WC Railway to meet 3000MT loading target," company said in its press release. The total cost of work is Rs 169,48,95,146 and to be executed in 540 days.
